description:
Pretty fantastic place; they're very good at what they do. Not swinging for the fences or trying to wow anyone with innovation, just straight-ahead no-b.s. drinks with solid service at a fair price. They also fill in for me as a Red Sox bar when I need one close to home, or you can take in basketball or football or anything else seasonal at the right time.

Beer selection is on point. I'm not a hop-head but they have Lagunitas and Voodoo Ranger, which is enough variety to keep IPA fiends happy. Guiness always, 805 on the regular lately, and Allagash is a good addition for a choice wheat beer option. Add a Jameson or Fernet for $5, and you can be well on your way on the first round. They seem to take pride in spreading Fernet to the masses. Any cocktail you order will do the job and they're not tight with their pours. The prices are good, not dirt cheap, but they never short anyone.

All in all it's a comfortable place for people who like to drink, well lived-in but divey but never scary. I don't know a better bar that's cheaper or a cheaper bar that's better, so they're a great destination when you're down for a mellow night taking in a game or a conversation in a small group.
author: James D.

description: The R Bar is my favorite place to get a drink and watch a game in San Francisco. The drink places are extremely reasonable for SF, the drinks are never watered down, and I love the bartenders. Cannot recommend this place high enough
author: David B.

description: So much fun! Browns fans from Cle here on holiday and got to watch the game with other fans. First win of the season and a great time! Thanks R Bar!
author: Gina P.

description:
Excellent staff, deceptively good alcohol selection whether or not you like Fernet.

Ed and Will are great, this place holds a surprising number of people and the local regulars are extremely normal somehow.

Good place to watch football or old movies late night.
author: David A.

description: Had a great time here. The two bartenders here really worked hard to make our bachelorette party memorable. A friend of mine was pregnant and Andrew was beyond thoughtful and provided her with virgin drinks so she wouldn't feel left out. We felt like they absolutely went out of their way to make our night special.
author: Veronica m.

description: Ooooh snap.  We stopped by for the Leprechaun Pub Crawl and got a little attitude from the but bartender was on point with his lemon drop.  Whole guacamole it was one of the best drinks we have had in San Francisco.
author: A M W.

description:
Situation 
- Friday evening at 9:00 PM
- My friend orders two well whiskey's and diet - $12
- I order a double well whiskey and diet, and a well whiskey and diet = $21

Pros 
- Decent atmosphere

Cons
- Very expensive for a dive bar ($10 well drinks), Kozy Kar nearby is so much better
- For a watering hole, there are much better and cheaper places
author: Dipesh G.

description:
We wanted a change of venue, so we all decided to stop by R Bar after having a couple drinks nearby. It was this past Wednesday, April 6th around 7:30pm.

I was keeping it low key, so I just ordered a Bud light and a shot of Jameson ($9). I believe you can choose Fernet instead of Jameson with this special if you like fernet more. I'm not a huge fan of bud light, but it did the trick in keeping my subtle buzz going. We were here for a good two hours, so I also ordered a beer later. Can't remember the brand, but it was $4. No bad price wise.

I loved the vibe of R Bar. Very laid back. It wasn't very busy when we were here, so it was perfect as our group of five just wanted to hang out and catch up. We grabbed some seats at the bar and just drank and talked the night away.

Great low key bar. They also have a few TVs of if you want to catch a game while having a drink or two.

Note: I believe their credit card minimum is $15, so bring cash if you're not in a big drinking mood.
author: Elena N.

description: Okay, you walk into a bar and ask for a beer. This place...There was a middle-aged employee behind the bar that was taking care of everything other than serving drinks. I didn't know that this person wasn't an employee. When I ask for a beer, he claims that he isn't an employee. Then, another "employee" that was taking care of a transaction on a credit machine, turns around to address me, and I ask for a beer. He says, "I'm taking care of another customer, and if you don't like it, you can leave," which I did immediately. I did not cause any trouble other than asking for a beer. I would avoid this place. MAYBE, IT IS BECAUSE I AM ASIAN??  I swear to God, all I did was ask for a beer at a place that serves beer....Un-fucking-believable. They are complete DICKS....
author: Jane S.

description: Love this bar. Great staff, vibe and generous owners. A definite feel good local place.
author: Haley H.

description: R Bar....stiff drinks at a reasonable price and in a centrally located part of town. However, the younger staff could learn a lesson in customer service. Save the attitude. This isn't a club in Vegas.
author: Mike K.

description: R Bar is legit.  Andrew is the man.  The fresh-pressed grapefruit juice Paloma w/ a splash of Elderflower is ridiculously on point. Highly recommended. Thank you.
author: Asa Z.

description:
Great place to watch important games

Bartenders are friendly and really know how to mix a drink.

Good neighborhood dive vibe...
author: Tammy P.

description:
I love this dive.  I initially came to this bar to watch an Oregon football game with some fellow alumni.  Because this bar is owned by Oregon alumni (they also own Wreck Room) the bar hosts watch parties where you can usually get a beer koozie with "go ducks" on it.  Everyone who works here is friendly and a bit sarcastic, but in a good way.  Draft beers are $5, and there are a few other cheap drink specials.  R Bar doesn't serve food, but they're ok with you bringing something in.  Also, R Bar is dog friendly, and specially on a weeknight you will find a pup or two enjoying the bar too.  As others have mentioned, the bathrooms are nothing special.  I've definitely unclogged the women's toilet before, and apparently, the men's bathroom is bigger than the women's, which kind of makes sense, because R Bar tends to have a more male dominated crowd. 
  
I was here one year for Santa Con, and a very drunken Santa wouldn't stop bugging me.  He was speaking undecipherable nonsense about how some girl had just broken up with him...or at least that's what I thought he was saying...and he started to slam his fists against the bar.  I got the attention of the bartender closest to me and told him that the guy was bugging me.  At first they made him go to the other end of the bar and finish his drink there.  He slowly kept inching towards me, and after the bartender told him to stop a couple times, the bartender took his drink away and kicked him out.  The bartenders here don't mess around - they're very protective.
author: Stephanie V.

description:
R bar is that place in my neighborhood where I always walk by on the way somewhere else and think, damn I need to check that out - it's only a block away. Well, finally went last night and it did not disappoint.  From the outside R Bar looks like a small hole in the wall and to be frank I thought it would be a little grimy dive bar like most of Polk street (I'm lookin at your McTeagues and your sticky floors!) But  to my surprise R Bar was a nice intimate (did I just say that) setting to grab a drink.  Maybe it was the off time of the day/week that I went but I really enjoyed it here. 
This is a small venue but the bar itself is large as well as plenty of seating along the rail and a whole open area in the back.  There was a decent crowd here for a Thursday night but nothing too rowdy and crazy, just some neighborhood folks enjoying a cold beer with a shot on the side (I think the special is a shot/beer for $9.... pretty good deal). I was not about to start taking shots on a Thursday night, but did grab a Green Flash Soul Style IPA for $6. Cold beer, friendly service, cleaaaannnnn bar. I'll be back.
author: Kelsey B.

description: $9 for a bud light and Jameson! Bartenders were attentive and fast and it's fun sitting down and talking here since the music isn't too loud where you have to yell like at most other places.
author: Leah A.

description:
Before starting your night of regrets on Polk Street, stop in R Bar so you don't break your bank. For $8, you can have your choice of a shot of Jameson/fernet with a tall can of Bud Light. Granted, drinking the can of Bud Light made me feel like I was back in college being punished for sucking at beer pong... I can't really complain because cheap beer also gets the job done.

This dive bar is everything a dive bar offers - not that glamorous, simple/cheap selection of alcohol, but still a comfortable place to drink. Bartenders are attentive and cool. Bathrooms are small, but hey, we're in SF, so what was I expecting?
author: Christine S.

description: San Francisco dive bar at it's finest! This place is fun and a ton of it. Some of the best drink prices around metro San Fran. We stumbled upon this place a long time ago and always make a point to come back anytime were in the area. Good music, great drinks, and a helluva a bunch of crazy people out to have fun. I'm sure there's classier joints around but why go classy when you can whoop it up and have some fun. When we were drunkenly invited by some more drunk people we met had no clue our bar was really R bar! They said were gonna take you to R bar and I was so confused. All that changed once we arrived. What a blast! Love R bar. Nothing but good times!
author: Chadrick J.

description: Cool bar off the beaten path.  Came here St Paddy's Day weekend.  All the tourist on Polk St.  Locals hang out.  Bartenders are awesome.  My new Frisco hangout!
author: Michael M.

description:
After bar hopping on polk my friends and I randomly asked these girls where the next stop was and we followed them here! While my friend unsuccessfuly hit on the girl we followed here (she was married), I ordered a malibu pineapple that I don't even remember drinking. 

I must've been drunker than I thought because I walked into the mens bathroom and started yelling at this guy wondering why he was peeing in the women's bathroom and he turns around mid piss and goes uhh you're in the mens bathroom but he said it in the nicest way!! Then I apologize and walk back out and someone else redirected me to the women's bathroom. I love nice people and this bar is clearly filled with them! Hooray!!!!
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Such a cool little place on Polk street. I always enjoy my time when I visit. It's not dreadfully crowded on weekends and it's just the right amount of dive, if that ever exists.

However, being the contemplative individual I am, I wondered for a long time what the "R" in R Bar stands for... here are my suggestions:

- Really good and inexpensive drinks. Some cocktails up on the board are $5. I believe it's the "cheap booze" board
- Ridiculously generous pourings of liquor. We ordered a couple of Glenlivets and the glasses were filled almost to the brim
- Rad interior with black walls and candle-lit ambiance
- Rock-ambient music in the background - nothing too flashy but fits right in with the mood here
- Ravishing ladies who I met that one night... long story
- Risque paintings on the wall. Seriously check them out; I wish I could have one for my room
- Ruff! I saw a couple of dogs here once--drunk petting is the best 
- Raucous crowd that is always ready to take on the night on Polk st

Definitely come here if you're Polk hopping on weekends.

---

Distinguishing factor: A dive bar that is unexpectedly welcoming and artistic. It's not located directly on Polk St., which basically halves the number of people aware of it.
author: Nick A.

description:
The awesomeness of R Bar starts with it being the home to the SF chapter of the amazing University of Oregon Ducks. In addition, it's also a NY Jets bar, Fernet and several other team fan destinations. Affiliations aside, that's where the awesomeness unfortunately ends.

R Bar isn't all that spacious and it becomes very apparent very quickly when the weekend crowds come a cluttering in. It becomes difficult to score a drink at the bar, let alone just trying to scream over the crowd. Maneuvering through them becomes a tricky dance and there isn't much escape from the lack of solid ventilation.

Bathrooms are a mess, but this is never a surprise in a dive bar. No one expects a spotless piece of shiny toilet porcelain by any means, but the stench of urine is enough to keep folks from using it entirely. This is only the men's side of course, but I suspect the women's restroom may not fare much better.

The prices aren't backbreaking, which keeps the drunken spirits alive. Well drinks aplenty and just enough beers to keep most folks happily hydrated. To the bartender's credit, they'll make drinks potent enough to make squeamish faces post sip, but if one can find a suitable drinking hour depends largely on the crowds. Enjoy the $5 drinks!
author: Jando S.

description:
I remember walking in, I remember having someone buy me multiple shots of fernet, I kind of remember chugging a few too many olympias, and i definitely do not remember picking up the wrong bag. I'm pretty sure I had a very lovely evening. 

PS- if it was your bag I grabbed on accident, I brought it back to the bar.  I was going to buy you a taco bell gift card (I saw you were stashing some sauce when I looked for an ID to contact you)- but I was worried you wouldn't go back to get it and that it would be a lost taco bell gift card in a lost bag. I'm sorry, I'm a really nice person, I swear. I hope you have a lovely day and I hope at some point our paths cross, hopefully in a taco bell.  Tacos on me.
author: laura c.

description: We tried R bar. Bartender was funny & friendly. Just a small local dive bar. Great place yo hang out for a couple drinks.
author: Christopher C.

description: Nice little hole in the wall bar.  Bartender was was very nice and quick with drinks.
author: Brad S.

description: Great bar to watch Oregon Duck Games at and the bartenders are awesome. Would definitely recommend going here if you like a great dark in the Tenderloin.
author: Croz M.

description:
Eclectic describes the crowd, cheap describes the drinks.  Overall, a dirty, divey, but FUN little joint to get the night started.  For the price, you really can't go wrong.  

PROTIP:  Small bathrooms.
author: David C.

description: Love this bar. Miguel is great and super sweet. The crowd is friendly and the prices are awesome. Gummie bear is my new favorite drink!
author: Gizelle S.

description: Great bar. If you're into dive bars this is the place to go. Super chill, a great place to go and socialize. and the bartender, Chris, is awesome. Great service and friendly. You can't go wrong with this place.
author: Cesar R.

description:
I love this place! It's a great bar to come to if you ever want to have great and cheap drinks. Enrique at the door is a sweet heart. The bar tenders are attentive and always check up on you to make sure you feel welcomed. 
This is a small bar with great music and beautiful paintings on the brick walls. There's always a great selection special drinks on the board. Very affordable  and worth your money. Bathrooms are small but the cleanest I have seen on Polk st.  
If your ever around the neighborhood, make sure to stop by. Everyone there is awesome and make you feel at home!
author: Stacy G.

description:
Watched the last part of game 1 in the NBA finals of 2015 here. The place was packed, yet you could still get a $7 draft beer within 30 seconds. The place isn't that big compared to some other bars in the area, but I think that is a plus in terms of atmosphere.

There's a small but decent selection of draft beer. Liked it.
author: Malthe J.

description:
Always closing time.
Pregnant girls: they drink for free!
A night to Fernet.
author: Nish N.

description:
I had an awesome time here and it was all because of our bartender, Ethan. He was so attentive and treated us like great friends. We had gone to R Bar early on in the night so it wasn't super packed and it was a relaxed and fun time. Ethan told us to go to their other bar, "Wrecked Room" to be around a younger crowd and texted the bartenders over there to let them know we were coming and to look for us! He wanted us to come back before last call so he could make us another drink and offered to pay for our ride home if we went back to see him. We ended up losing track of time and not making it back, and I'm so disappointed we didn't. 
If you go here on a Friday night hopefully Ethan will be working because he will make your night!
author: Christen G.

description:
I spent my 'Going Away/Finished USMLE' get-together here. The original plan was bar hop all around Polk St. but we ended up just staying here.

It's my ideal kind of dive bar that doesn't have loud music, not too crowded, drinks are decently priced, and service is quick.

I drank too much and fell asleep at one of the tables and then I was kicked out--owned. That was a first. It was embarrassing but not because I was being the opposite of belligerent. It was fun while it lasted. I may be back another day and not sleep there.

Jukeboxes are necessary at social functions.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Good beer, Oregon Games, and a fun atmosphere.  LOVE LOVE LOVE the R Bar.  We went for an Oregon game a few weeks ago, and Puddles showed up!!  Not even kidding - he even went behind the bar for a little bit - but he wouldn't do any push ups.   

They are opening a new business where La Barca used to be as well.  It's a bar/american food venue - looking forward to checking it out!
author: Cori D.

description:
My wife and I stopped in here for a drink while vacationing in San Francisco. It was near our hotel and the description on Yelp reminded us of the bars we like at home. The staff was very welcoming and very "generous" with the pour on the drinks we received. We had a great time talking to other patrons and slowly getting drunker and drunker. 

We were convinced by a pair of friendly locals to try Fernet. It was horrible yet at the same time awesome. I can't stop talking about it so it must not have been as unpleasant as it initially felt. The ginger ale chaser helped a little but nothing could have prepared me for that. It may have been what put me over the edge. We managed to stumble home so don't believe the hype about the neighbourhood.
author: John M.

description: This is kind of a cool bar that my friend recommended. They have Flor de Caña, which if you know me, is always good in my book. The bartenders were pretty cool. I don't remember how much my drinks cost, but I don't think they were that expensive. And they were showing Tropic Thunder. Winning.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
My favorite dive bar in the city and my favorite bloody mary!!

I initially discovered this fantastic little whole in the wall because they have a Browns Backers club that meets here on sundays to watch the games. GO BROWNS!! I was very pleasantly surprised to find they have the best bloody mary I have had in San Francisco.. a much needed addition to my Sunday mornings when I have to get to the bar at 10 am to cheer on a football team that has been letting me down since the 80's. 

While this place certainly has no frills, the bartenders are great, the people are friendly and the drinks are strong. Definitely worth checking out!
author: Jess K.

description:
I hate when one bad person can ruin an experience for an entire business. But that just means that all of the employees need to conduct themselves with propriety as they are representing the name "R Bar". 

I would definitely give this place at least 4 stars. I forget whether it is cash only or not but I do remember that the drinks were awesome and fast. There was no cover or line which makes the bar even more awesome to me. The bouncer outside was super nice and genuine. There was even a small dance floor to have a good ole' time and shake it down after a couple sips. 

What bothered me was when the bartender (didn't know he was the bartender) outside dropped his lighter and then shoved his rear end in my personal space. I didn't have the most inviting look on my face and was a bit put off. He stood up, looked at me and said "I'm sure you will feel differently when I'm making your drinks!". So what...? That gives you an excuse to act a fool because you are the great "mixologist" making my drinks? So then I was scared of ordering drinks the whole night...I guess he did a good job exerting his power play...

Nonetheless, my friend ordered drinks and tried to go to another bartender all night. But if you were to just subtract that one bartender, we would have had such an awesome evening! I'm excited to go back and I hope I'll be able to write a more positive update. 

All in all, no cover, no line, great drinks, nice dance floor, but 1 heavyset bartender who acted inappropriately.
author: Leena B.

description:
Pretty dope. Came on a Thursday night by myself. Post work type crowd. Got a shot. Talkative bartenders. Lifts your mood if you're down.
Sports playing on tvs.
author: Harry M.

description: If you're looking to have a chill night with a good drink and meet some interesting people this is the place for you. It's a simple bar, with extra standing room and some bar stools and tables here and there. They tend to play movies on the tvs they have around the place and the music that is played isn't too loud or obnoxious. What really makes this place are the bartenders. Miguel, Andrew and Will are all pretty awesome guys that kept the drinks flowing and the night entertaining! Will definitely be back whenever I'm in the city.
author: Clarissa L.

description:
After arriving at R Bar at 10:30pm on the Monday after the Oregon Ducks were contenders in the BCS National Championship game and seeing nothing but empty bar stools and long faces, there was no need to turn on ESPN to determine the outcome of the biggest college football game of the year. Since R Bar is the official Oregon Ducks bar here in SF (not to mention the official Fernet bar!), the place would be rocking well into the wee hours had the outcome been different. Oh well, they'll get 'em next year. 

When it's not football season, R Bar is one of those old standbys that's sure to do the trick when you're bumming around the Tenderloin and looking for an efficient way to attain a tasty buzz. Tall cans of Bud Light are a mere $3, Fernet will run you $5, and I'm sure there are a whole host of other drink specials I'm not quite privy to. But rest assured - you'll get in-and-out without spending too much coin. Always a good thing. 

It can be a royal clusterfuck on the weekends, though. So like any true alcoholic, try doing your best damage on a Monday or Tuesday night. Otherwise, high tide might sweep you into an ocean of douche. Beat the beat, bro.
author: Ruggy J.

description: A nice bar tat was extremely crowded during Santa Con. I think the place is a nice hangout with a decent beer selection.
author: Ruobin W.

description: R Bar is your typical dive bar. I went to watch a Niners game, and it was a good place for that sort of thing. I wouldn't bend over backwards to go here but I think overall it made sense considering why I was there. It's a pretty convenient location near in nob hill/north beach.
author: Priya S.

description: Decent little dive off of Polk Street.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Love this place!  Its only a few blocks from home and one of the few places on Polk street that takes credit cards.  The art on the walls is very interesting and sometimes disturbing, the drinks are strong and the bartenders are fast and friendly.
And the music is usually pretty cool.  Its just a cool neighborhood bar to hang out and have a couple of stiff drinks before you head home or...
author: Antoine V.

description:
R Bar is like a comfortable pair of shoes, man!
I haven't been here in over a year and a half but it was like I never left.
When you go here you have to have a shot of Fernet and so do all your worthless friends. I did mine and I became worthless if not useless.

So goodbye R bar for another year when I'll come back avoid the high fives and girls howling for whatever they howl for.

Good Times
Bad Times
You know I've had my share
author: Alexander R.

description: This place is the essence of a dive bar. Small, dark and dingy with a neighborhood feel. The bartenders and bouncers are all cool and the Fernet flows like water. They always have some interesting beer/shot combos that are great to start a night with. This place is an SF institution -- props to Will and the gang for making it awesome.
author: Bobby N.

description: Cheap beers, good people, good bartenders, divey, dark, street fighter 2 and samurai showdown in the back room. Great place.
author: John D.

description: Drinks are cheap and plenty of room to socialize. Come here for a few drinks and keep it pushing. On to the next bar.
author: Angel R.

description:
Well, writing a positive review is difficult so I'll keep it short and sweet (not unlike me).

The people who work here are some of my favorite dudes on the planet. Don't be surprised to see me stopping in here no matter who is tending because I love their stupid faces.

Be nice to them.. And by nice I mean shower them in sarcasm. Oh-- the bar itself is cool too. It has booze.
author: Kasena K.

description:
My girls and I found ourselves huddled around R Bar's jukebox late one Friday night. It's a good thing we came equipped with single because here, the jukebox is the DJ! 

The bar stayed pretty jam packed the whole night but the $5 Vodka drink specials made the wait bearable, even though I personally don't care for Vodka all that much. They also have a few side tables (standing room only) but the bar is narrow so you're elbow-to-elbow web other patrons., which is okay because this bar is a good time - not pretentious or snooty. Definitely a place to let your hair down and throw back one or two (or three). 

Apparently there is only one tiny restroom (yikes) so be prepared!
author: Mariela D.

description: The best bloody Mary's don't need a pile of bacon and weird spices and unexpected salts on the rim. The best Bloody Mary just tastes perfect, and can be found at R Bar. No weird salts, no shrimp or house-pickled okra or anything. Two olives, a peppercini and the best house bloody mix I've ever had the luck to imbibe.
author: Jessica B.

description: This is the designated Oregon bar in SF, and any O fans know it!  I went here for a game one Saturday and boy was it fun!!  The only critique I have is that they don't serve food, which is a bummer for noon games, but there is a delicious burrito place next door so it isn't a huge deal.  Overall it's a great bar to watch a game, especially with all the fun and excitement of Ducks!!  They also have good drink specials during the games.  I haven't been here any other time, but it seems like an overall great dive bar, and I wouldn't mind checking it out on a non-football day as well
author: Allison R.

description:
BEST CLEVELAND BROWNS BACKERS BAR IN SAN FRANCISCO!!

I moved to SF Bay area almost a month ago & spent the last 4 weeks searching for a Cleveland Browns bars. My only requirement is that I wanted to spend my time with at least more than one backers fan.

All the bars I went to on the SF Backer's list were a bust... up until now!

What I mean is - you go to a sports bar out here & you're stuck listening to another game while being pushed into a corner with one other fan.
The raiders & the 49ers always take the center stage - which I completely understand- I'm in their town, but sorry, I'm a die hard & want to see & hear & enjoy my game! 

I heard that the first game of the season at this bar, there were more than 40 browns backers hanging out, but I suppose as the season went on, as always, fans became sparse.

I also read that last review about the browns game from Sept, and I think they might have been one of the 40 who never returned.  All is good here now - cozy browns game watching - no spazzy televisions that I found.

Well, I'm posting this review so that other browns fans can come and join in on the fun with all of us.  We're here - and it's not worth your time going anywhere else in the bay area - I checked!

This bar did play other games (cincinatti, baltimore, detroit, carolina were just a few that I remember), but because it is a smaller bar, it caters to your needs more than the other big sports bars in the area
author: A F.

description:
So, we stumbled into the loud dimness from down the block at oh, 1am or so, and took a table in the back. 

Shaking off rain drops, we noticed we were the, er, the most ethnic people in the joint, but figured, every establish could use a little color. 

Glanced toward the bartender, noticed there's a "Cheap-o drink" menu etched in neon squeaky behind the bar. The choices were infused Svedka vodkas w/ soda for 5 bucks or some God-forsaken beer option. I choose... Cherry vodka and 7-up. Score. 

As the music permeated, I realized, "WE are the DJ!" So, we stepped over to the ancient juke and flipped thru the oddly listed choices of yesteryear's beats. Submitted our dollar for two choices: Sexy and I Know It and The Children's Story (Slick Rick, duuuuuuh). 

Many songs later, we had gyrated to every imaginable MJ hit, and still no LMFAO, even though we did a lot of LMFAOing in the interim. After our drunken investigation, we concluded that the person before us must've submitted $5, for EIGHTEEN fricken songs! Ugh, selfish whino. 

After failing miserably at our revision of the Thriller and Beat It dance, we stumbled out to Bob's Donuts. 

Regardless- I'm sexy and I know it.
author: Kiki I.

description:
R Bar is great and getting better!

Recently renovated to reveal exposed red brick walls and added pub tables for a historic tavern look and feel.

R Bar's always been a solid neighborhood bar by day where everybody knows your name, while nighfall is a a winfall brings good jukebox tunes, good vibes delivered through sound system and shots of Fernet. 

I think, I thought I saw a dance floor here last night?  

Even better! R Bar is where I watch my sports. With 5 Flat Screens there's more than enough room for New York Jets Fans to share the joint with Cleveland Browns Fans and locals; and Saturday afternoon's belong to Oregon Ducks fans. 

Must See TV!
author: Dean B.

description:
I love this place.  It's the perfect neighborhood bar.

There's a bunch of flat screens to watch whatever game you wanna watch... and if there's not a game on then there's always a good movie playing.  The other night they were playing Basic Instinct and I watched Michael Douglas and Sharon Stone doing the dirty with about 30 strangers in total silence (except for the music playing from the jukebox.) There's also a room in the back with video games.  Play Big Buck Hunter. FUN!

The bartenders are just a bunch of really friendly good people.  Buy them a drink or two or three.  Treat them as well as they treat you!
author: Jessica F.

description: My friend Leslie and I hit R Bar in the mid-week...not too busy...about 10 cats (including us) and a dog...literally.  The place is VERY divey but Andrew, the bartender, is a class act...and soooooooo funny.  Going to R Bar is like going for drinks and a show when Andrew is bartending...and he makes a mean Cosmo, yes! at a dive bar...music was also awesome - compliments of who?  Andrew and his Ipod of course!...We had a great evening, and my friend Leslie had the time of her life!
author: Adriana P.

description:
Decided to go to Polk street one night with a friend that was out of town. I didn't know this place was popular!! Polk street is the place to be! We came here after a halloween weekend and people were still out and about in costumes. We tried to go into a few bars and everything was packed! 
My friends and I were frustrated so I stopped at a corner and looked up yelp for just a plain dive bar. R bar came up. Perfect place! It wasn't too packed and they had cheap beers and good music. Our night ended up turning out awesome because of this bar! So thank you! We will be back!
author: Lana K.

description:
I didn't know this was a Browns backers bar... might have to give it another try during football season to see if it can redeem itself at all.

Otherwise... why do people like this place?  So-so drink prices.  Relatively unfriendly bar staff.  The whole place smells... like the Tenderloin.  I'm not sure I've ever been in such a filthy and smelly bar restroom, and I frequent some pretty dive-y places.  God, the piss smell....
author: Heidi M.

description: Love my boys are R bar.  My husband and I have been coming here forever and this our fav dive bar.  Love coming to watch football on sundays or just coming in on weekends to do some good old day drinking.  This is a shot and beer bar.  You want fancy cocktails you need to find another spot.
author: Kimberly W.

description:
This is my 2nd favorite bar in my hood. The booze is reasonably priced and the bar tenders are all super friendly. That's a rarity to not at least have one pain in the ass bartender, I'm impressed!

My first night there after I moved to the hood I chatted with Chris (bartender and I think part owner?) and he effortlessly pulled me into a conversation with some other regulars and I ended up there much later than I intended. Partially thanks to the "welcome to the neighborhood" free Jameson he hooked me up with.

The space is moderate in size but beware: If you go on a Friday or Saturday night the place is a'gonna be crazy packed. We're talkin' wall to wall people environment where you have to squish through people for 5 minutes just to make it 15 feet.

This is all good though, I mean there are a ton of people there for a reason right? The crowd is eclectic and generally pretty drunk. Good times, good times.
author: Justin N.

description:
AWESOME BAR!!!

Requirements for an awesome bar:
1.) reasonable priced brew ($4)
2.) packed bar
3.) laid back/friendly crowd
4.) good ratios

Peeps this place has it all.  Came here two friday's ago and had a blast.  Everyone was super chill and outgoing.  Its a bummer we had to leave early, but will DEFINITELY be returning to my new favorite sf bar..
author: Mike M.

description:
The Bartender here made my experience a five star.  He just sat and chilled with us for hours talking about how the bar got started 8 years ago and the city of SF and even introduced us to an SF favorite Fernet!

He gave us free shots and was pretty much the best bar tender Ive ever had.  Definitely coming back.
author: Brandon A.

description: This is a great place with an awesome    atmosphere. The people are cool and friendly. There bar tender ED is a straight up bad ass dude and his drinks are things of perfection. If you are looking for a place to grab a drink in the city. Put this place on the list.
author: Travis R.

description:
What can I say, R-Bar is the place to be:
My gal friends and I have deemed this our favorite bar, it's in the heart of the Tendernizzle and we've even had total fun on a Sunday.  

The je ne sais quois of R Bar:  
You never know what crowd you're going to get, and it's between either extreme of being very chill or brushing elbows crowded.  Either way, it's cool and definitely order a Jamba Juice shot, my fave.  Or their famous Fernet which is on the list of bucket things to try in SF.

It may be a place to find someone great:  
My good friend met her bf there and after about a year, they are engaged! 

****************************************************************************

They're always on the up and up on holidays/events and it's a cool place to throw a party which I've done twice, once for my birthday and a pre-Halloweenie thing last year.  The owners are also Mighty Ducks and Giants fans and when they're not tuning into sports on their flatscreens there's always a good indy/oldie movie playing.  

If you happen to stroll in, don't forget to pass by the jukebox and play my fave - 2006! 

The crew is awesome, owners are laid back and cool, and you'll feel at home.  It's the modern day Cheers where they will remember you and know your name.

***************************************************************************

They also just opened up the Wreck Room Bar a few weeks ago.  Bigger venue with pool table, videogames and hoops.  I've only been there once, the crowd was very random when I went.  Hyde and California, can't miss it with the big sign on the side of the building.  Something new to try!  

xo reecey cup
author: C Q.

description:
When the bartender knows just how shitty you're feeling and gives you a new glass of rum & coke immediately after your last sip...

you know you're in the right place.

Oh, and they played "Damn It Feels Good to be a Gangsta"

HOW THE FUCK CAN YOU GET ANY BETTER THAN THAT?!
author: Jaime L.

description:
Fernet about it! They say you are the company you keep...I like the company of Chris and the staff at R Bar. On any given night, the swanky and mostly single head to R Bar for some booze and flirtation. It's a small place - with seemingly tall people - that have always been approachable and out for a good time.
Best to hit R Bar before a show at Great American or a meal on Polk St.
author: Kyle T.

description: Local bar, if you don't drink Fernet you should keep walking to McTeague's.
author: Patrick P.

description: Great place to cheer on the Oregon Ducks! I have only been here once but I am a fan! Low priced drinks, friendly bartenders, and wasn't too crowded. It was fun to be around fellow duck alumni! I will definitely be back!
author: Ashly B.

description:
Should be a 2.5, but unable to split a star from here.
The bartenders are some of my favorite in the city.  Great service!  
The pictures in the men's room are the other reason to go there.
However, the Marina factor in this place makes it into the kind of place I don't go to often. On the rare occasion that I do,  I remember why I haven't been in a while about 30 seconds into my visit.  When this place falls out of style it will be OUTSTANDING.
author: Nelson W.

description: Hey!  You!  Stay away from this place.  I love this bar and it's laid-back atmosphere, awesome bartenders, and  fantastic mixed drinks are all mine.  Seriously, one of the best things about this place is that I rarely have to wait for a bar stool or to order.  It's dark in the back, like a good neighborhood bar should be, has some inexpensive drinking options for those between paychecks, and even a private room in the back for those who need to plot secretly or shoot electronic deer...
author: Sam G.

description:
10.22.10

Always a good time on Polk Street.

Just don't end up at R Bar at the end of the night with Fernet.  That stuff is disgusting.  Why do people like it?

I remembered the first time I tried it at Sens.  It looked like jaeger, but tasted worse than any Chinese herbal medicine concoction I have ever sipped.  Barf, please.

That said, R Bar still maintains a chill atmosphere despite being packed most of the time.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Go Ducks!
Yes this is the Oregon Ducks San Francisco Game Watching Headquarters (ODSFWH). 
The bar tenders are awesome and they are even more awesome if you are an Oregon fan. 
Drinks are reasonably priced and the crowd is always friendly (sometimes a little too friendly if you're a girl)

Oregon game days here will blow you away, everyone is decked (or "ducked") out in green and yellow, the Coors Light girls show up, sometimes the Duck makes an appearance... it's the closest thing San Francisco will ever have to Autzen...after all it never rains at R Bar.
author: Julia T.

description: R bar!!!! I heart this place.  The bartender is amazing, constantly comin up with different drinks.  Thank you, r bar for hosting so many parties.  I can't wait for the nye party!!!
author: Oriana C.

description: Another place a frequent because its good for groups, its consistent, good amount of space, clean, good service. It doesn't really have much special to offer, just the usual beers, but it has a certain charm to it. The most memorable thing about it is the deer hunter arcade game in the back room. Good memories. Just fun when you're drinking.
author: Dexter H.

description:
You know I'm not sure how to review R bar.  There are many different R Bars so I'm just going to review the one I know.  It involves Saturday or Sunday afternoons, sometimes Sunday nights.  It also usually involves NY or Boston Sports, the crowd is a bit different from the evening crowd or Oregon Duck crowd.  If you are in early enough and its not too busy, order a Bloody Mary.  Unfortunately the only way to sum it up is to quote the oh-so-famous marina d-bag, thanks SF Eater. "You can't fake awesome!"

The bartender is super sweet, you can tell he loves working there.  He also tries to get to know everyone which makes it that much more friendly and welcoming. I might even compare it to Cheers, might, maybe, don't get too excited.  So my trips in usually go like this:  Hi, I'm just stopping in for a drink, have some nice conversation, watch some sports and head out.  OR, I'll go in, watch some sports and realize 5 hours has elapsed and I'm about 4 beers past where I start making bad decisions.  Even so its always been extremely fun, I will continue to frequent their bar and so should you.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description:
We came on a Saturday night for some cheap drinks as our first stop for barhopping. We came here around 9:30pm and stayed until about 11pm. The bartender was great! He chilled our drinks for us and was very friendly. We were talking about the movie that was playing on the TV. It was some 80s movie I've never heard about but it was funny. We're guessing it's the movie where "peeping Tom" originated from. Haha. There were some $5 "dude" vodka shots that night and they were okay. We just wanted to give it a try. There was an adequate amount of space to sit at the bar and also some tables on the side. Everyone looked like they were having a good time.

Well, somewhat funny story about the bathroom. I couldn't tell which bathroom was male or female because there were just two pictures outside the doors that you can't really see in the dark. I just went into either one since they were basically just normal toilets with stalls. Haha, oh well. But for future reference, females, your bathroom is to the left and for the males, yours is to the right. 

$15 minimum to pay with card, otherwise bring cash.
author: Connie Y.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night after going to a post-Yom Kippur break-the-fast, so I was still in my suit.  Nonetheless, the vibe was good and the crowd was entertaining.  Incredibly nice and attentive bartenders.  Drinks were decently priced (there was a special on Newcastle that night, $3, plus you got a free glass!).  I was especially happy with how happy and willing the bartenders were to constantly refill my glass of water (between paid drinks, of course).  At the end of the night, as a cherry on the cake, my friend and I were poured a complimentary Fernet shot and ginger ale chaser, I guess for being good patrons and fair tippers.  

Overall, it was a fantastic experience, I'd certainly come back!
author: Eric M.

description:
The last two times I've been to R Bar, Animal House has been playing on the TV's mute with the closed captioning on.  I love it.  Kudos to the management.

The scene here leans a little bit more preppy than its Lower Polk Street neighbors like Hemlock or McTeague's.  There's a good range of drink choices from dive bar beer cans to top-shelf cocktails.  Prices are reasonable.  Service is good.  The girls are pretty.  It's a fine bar in every respect and definitely a place worth dropping by if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Andy B.

description: $8 Jameson+Bud Light Tall Boy  = a good idea all the time.
author: Egan B.

description:
I'd go here on a Saturday night to truly experience the feeling of what a menage a trois may possibly relay while riding the L during the business rush hour.

Such was my experience after hopping around town, but have to admit, that for the observing voyeur in me, people watching in this joint is tops.  

The mixture of backgrounds is pretty indicative, as it not only catered to regulars/locals, but a healthy representation of the Marina types still suited from earlier romps as well as East Bay was evident, replete with baseball caps worn sideways and puffy jackets trimmed with fake brown fur.

Grabbing the attention of the bartender is simple: either you know them in person or literally have to yell "Hey, over here" because he was busy exchanging neck kisses to a blonde at the bar.  Although, in this case, it was clearly strictly blondes that night (note to self, wear a blonde wig).  Otherwise, he responded quickly to the request, maybe because my friend was bigger than him.  Hahaha!!

I am going to do the horrible injustice to the theory of empiricism, but the drinks here are strong, even mixed.  I was unable to finish my generic Gin/Tonic mix, despite the sweetness the Schweppes imparted generously.  I took a sip of the Vodka/Soda mix that coupled next to my drink on the counter and it was too strong, making my eyelids pucker.

What made the experience better, was the Kill Bill playing on the numerous panel TVs throughout the bar, which catered most of my attention, especially since Uma was slicing up the Crazy 47..or was it 46?
author: Miika M.

description:
The typical clientele at this bar is over 30 and adds Is and Zs to words, for example "Let's get a drink-izzle." --Jay-Z quit doing that years ago izzles. 

People who live over the hill wander in here when they're broke to take shots and feel a little rough because they're hanging out in the Tenderloin. It has a neighborhood reputation for being a great place to pick up wasted bottle blondes at the end of a Saturday night when you have your beer goggles securely fastened, although, I've never stayed there until the end of the night to test it's reputation. 

The staff seems cool, it has alcohol, and if you're into sports you can catch the game.
author: Slim P.

description: Cool, relaxed bar. The girl to guy ratio here isn't the best, always a huge sausage fest. My friends and I always end up starting our night here if we go out on Polk St. One drink or two, then out on the town!
author: Samantha H.

description:
First, a word of advice from my bartender friend: Always pay cash for the first round and tip BIG! 

This was our strategy last night and it paid off. A couple cheap, yet heavily-poured double Makers on the rocks later and I was all smiles. I'm sure it helped that the bartenders at R Bar are cool, regular guys.

R Bar was characteristically loud last night, but the juke box was playing good songs. There are a lot of good songs in the R Bar juke box. Admittedly, there are also some terrible songs, so here is my work-around: never visit R Bar after 10pm on Friday or Saturday.

Visiting during the week or before 10pm on the weekends will dramatically limit your exposure to the people who have terrible taste in music and thus, ruin your R Bar experience with their jukebox selections.

Besides, weekend nights are a friggin' sausage fest' in there! ...and that is a little tip for the ladies.  ;-)
author: Brad L.

description: Love R Bar. It's probably my favorite bar on polk street. The drinks are reasonably priced and strong and the bartenders are friendly and outgoing. It's a nice ambiance and I've never been here when it was too crowded. It's just a feel good bar.
author: Junel S.

description:
I've been coming here for a few weeks now and I was waiting to write a review based on how consistent this place was.

I come here w/my gf to watch sports and throw back a few after work during the week. The drinks are cheap and the bartenders are cool. It's on the edge of the TL so you won't have to worry about bums trying to saunter in and ask you to buy them a drink. I did hear it gets a little douche-y on the weekend b/c the dicks from the Marina manage to make it up here.

I'll keep coming here during the weeknights to have fun.
author: Gary T.

description:
I have been coming here for years and it is a great place to come to. I love to come here on wednesday and saturdays to see Eric the most.

This bar is also great when it is not packed to the brim
author: Lisa W.

description:
Great relaxed bar. We went there on a Saturday night and it was not too crowded but just busy enough. The drink prices are decent and so is the crowd. 

The bartenders  were amazingly attentive and friendly. 

The only downfall is that they only have one bathroom for each sex. The bathroom is also very small. That is the only inconvenience. Otherwise, awesome place!
author: kassandra t.

description:
Supposedly no other establishment in the U.S. sells more Fernet than R Bar.  It could be a rat infested, single wide trailer in the middle of a skin head enclave...I'd still love it anyways.
Lucky for me, and everyone else in SF, it's actually a pretty spiffy spot.  
Kinda douchey on the weekends.
But a  fave during the week.
author: Leif N.

description:
I've tried to love R Bar, I really have.  A few friends swear by this bar so I seem to end up here at least once every few moths, but it's just not working out between us.  We don't see eye to eye, we don't have like the same things, and R Bar doesn't put out (a big no-no).

Everytime I go it's something.  Bar tenderrs who always ask "And who are you?" painfully, after you ask for the check.  A drunk door guy on New Years Eve letting some people in who hadn't paid, and keeping some people out who had.  Some incredibley cheap drinks, mixed in with drinks over priced for seemingly no reason...  Not to mention the waste of a dance floor (why have a dance floor when all you have is a juke box?), and the boring atmosphere.  

And no, I didn't knock them down because of the absolutely hit and miss crowd (They should change their name to "Creepy Guys R Us" from what I've seem most of the nights I've been there).  That doesn't have as much to do with a plane jane establishment like R Bar, as it does to do with trends, events, etc.  

I'm sure it's a great neighborhood bar, great off night bar, great college football bar, great fernett bar (god I hate fernett...), etc. but it's not weekend bar.  So, 2.5 stars since out of all my trips to R Bar none have been for a casual week night drink.

It's not you R Bar, it's me...
author: joe z.

description:
The drinks are inexpensive and the back room has Big Buck Hunter. I have spent many a weekend night of my single days there with my friends in that back room, drinking and shooting digital animals. I have also earned many a free drink by hustling guys who didn't think I could beat them. (I've gotten a perfect game before so consider yourself warned.)

The bartenders are pretty nice which is always a plus. A good spot for low-key drinking and the falsified rush of killing pretend animals.
author: K C.

description: Friendly bartenders. Cheap drinks ($4 for a chimay on a saturday), and awesome friendly crowd and music. What more can I ask for? Oh, I know a dance floor! and there was one in the back. Top it off with me doing a handstand on the bar, I def would come back again.
author: Kelly C.

description:
I'm terribly biased as an Oregon Ducks fan (this is the official UO bar), but this is a great dive/sports bar.  Cheap beers complete with the foam coozies.  The crowd is always a good mix, considering it's in the Tendernob.

One word of warning -- if you go in the Fall, check the Oregon football schedule before you venture in on a Saturday.  It's all quacked out.
author: Dan H.

description: It's your bar and it's my bar, it's R Bar!!!!!!
author: Rachel G.

description:
Love this place, it just never gets old. 

-great hole in the wall bar with some character. 
-awesome jukebox (seems like no good spots in SF have one these days)
-not too pricey
-great place to start a fri or sat night
author: Dave T.

description:
This is my favorite place to score a Fernet shot. Nice down to earth bartenders, although sometimes this place can be a sausage fest. 
Sunday's bloody mary's made by Ed are by far the best I have had in SF! Just the right amount of horseradish and spice! Yum yum.
author: Kehaulani K.

description:
Heard this was a good place to watch football.

Regardless just a solid neighborhood bar.

Decently priced drinks, lots of room, etc.
author: Francis M.

description:
I've only spent a few hazy minute in R Bar, but I like what I saw! With a fun crowd, loaded jukebox, and quick bartenders I don't know where there could be a problem. This is the kind of place that makes you know that you are kicking off a great night. 

Had a shot of fernet, and it tasted just fine, but I think I'll stick to Jaeger.
author: Kelly C.

description:
What can one say about this bar? If you're in the industry, this is where to go. I'm always well taken care of by the boys and never pay for a drink (LOL)!

Extremely low key, strong drinks, good staff, friendly atmosphere. Great place to go when you're not sure where to go. When I'm on Polk Street I go to R Bar to Kozy Kar and finish up at Bob's Donuts.

It's a perfect way to stumble home!
author: samantha r.

description:
Good bar close to other bars on Polk. 2 dollar Olympia. Young 20s to mid 20s crowd.

Fun and Crowded on Fri and Saturday nights.Good for a crazy night out

I'm gonna have to add this bar into my rotation
author: James B.

description:
I could give a damn about the game on TV, but nobody seemed to mind me sullenly drinking and writing at the bar.  Apparently I looked like I needed to drink last night because after buying three rounds, the bartender dropped off a 4th on the house.

Good prices, good beer selection and a bartender who knew the percent alcohol by volume of each off the top of his head make this the sort of place where I could brood again.
author: Quinn S.

description:
I give R bar 2 stars because they allowed hundreds of snuggies to invade their friday night, and gave us cheap drinks. I'm not really a dive bar kinda gal, maybe it's because I like going out and getting dolled up, and when you do that for a dive bar, people look at you funny. 
Anyways, if you are looking for that dark, dingy, almost illegal feel, R Bar fits the bill. 
I can't judge the crowd, because we were all in snuggies, but I will say the bouncer was awesome...I'm pretty sure he knew I had my drink in my snuggie sleeve every time I went in and out...he just laughed....
author: Bianca L.

description: Besides Kozy Kar, this is my favorite Polk St. Bar.  Quick bartenders, stiff drinks, and gets moderately crowded.  But if crowds aren't your thing, or that "sweet whisper" in someones ear turns out to be a scream, theres a small room in the back that is almost always empty (aside from the BIG BUCK HUNTER game, which I have fed all too much money)
author: Peter V.

description:
I wasn't here too long, but I liked what I saw at R Bar. 

Being a Seattle native that was visiting S.F for the first time, I was very happy to see that they served Olympia Beer in the can, like they do at home. 

If I lived in the neighborhood, I would easily stop by here once or twice a week to get a drink or to watch the game. 

I look forward to coming back.
author: Cameron B.

description: Perfect for watching the Duck games!!! 2nd best place to watch a duck game after Auzten... UO Alumni Publication.
author: Lizzie F.

description:
I've been hibernating the last couple of days but what a way to come out of hibernation by coming for the canned food drive.  I always love going to support a good cause.  The drinks are stiff, the bartenders are cool, their is a juke box and a dance floor and the decor is a mix between a lounge and a dive bar.  

I haven't been here for over a year and todd, the part owner/bartender was very nice and still remembered me.  Came here with a group of us.  Although I only stayed here for an hour or so, we all had a great time.  Will definitely come back.
author: jason g.

description:
It's amazing, you can smell the stale and bitter stench of beer from across the street. It's small dark and packed with meathead douchehbags all fighting over the few hammered chicks in the corner. 

I am sorry to be a hater, but it is not my scene. Two stars because it may not be my scene but for some of you it is. So, enjoy the STD's and have shot of Jagermeister for me.

Again, I am not a hater I guess I just have my own reasons for not liking this place. 

After a night at R Bar make sure to yelp about your local Planned Parenthood.
author: Adam M.

description:
Its a bar. It's a long bar... with some mirrors, appropriate lighting and a cheezy small space that at the end of the night turns into a dancefloor for over intoxicated, under intelligenced frat boys and girls to shimmy up to one another for a night full of potential regrets. 

There's nothing special here, its a bar at the end of the day and the clientele was such a turn off that I doubt I'll be coming back. We had encounters with way too many folks in college or more acurately, of college age but of a high school demeanor.

There are so many watering holes in the area that I don't see why one would want to park themselves at this one for the course of a night especially when 3 shots of crap well vodka costs $19. WTF?!
author: Len S.

description:
I don't really get the hoo-ha about this place because it's just a run-of -the-mill bar...yet somehow, a shot of Fernet at R Bar ended up on 7x7's list of 100 things to try in SF.

So okay, we made it stop #5 on my Bon Voyage, San Francisco tour.

* Enter
* WHOA it's crowded in here and it's only like 9PM!
* Drink our shots of Fernet with ginger chasers
* Do a bit of flirting with good looking young men even though at the ripe old age of 32, I'm pretty sure I had cougar status in that place
* Exit
* Meet my future husband outside while waiting for a cab
* Make Fernet-inspired promise to look for him on Craigslist Missed Connections
* The end

If I was 25 and lived in the neighborhood, I could see this being a go-to hangout but I'm not and I don't. But okay, three drinks = $16. Considering the highfalutin night we'd had up until then, this was a value I could appreciate.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
There's a reason that this is considered the douchiest bar in San Francisco:  the clientele.

 If you are looking to find a place to celebrate your recent success of finishing the semester at CCSF with a C- average, screaming at the top of your lungs for the next 3 hours and being out-and-out obnoxious, this is the bar for you.

Not a demographic that should be empowered.  Add alcohol and you have the epitome of amateurs.
author: Joe W.

description: GREAT Sunday bar! I know this is a bit late, but I watched a few NFL games there this past season. Beer specials...lots of TV's, good crowd, and loyal fans. I'll be back this season...if there is one...lol.
author: Seanté B.

description:
I think I was too harsh on R Bar back in January. It's a little unfair to generalize an entire establishment following my run in with a pushy 38 year old. Really, there is so much more.

- 37 year olds
- Cute 38 year olds
- 38 year old Oregon fans
- tall maybe attractive but who knows because it's dark twenty somethings
- short 38 year olds
- 38 year old Irish men on holiday who tell me that a "falling tree is easier to claim" and then offer to buy me another drink
- "hey we went to the same high school!" "what year did you graduate?" "1988" "Oh"
- 36 year olds
- 34 year olds with Prada phones and who think Abercrombie is for peons
- "I'm the male equivalent of a cougar. How YOU doin?"

Bottom line: this is the bar that I find myself winding up at on a regular basis these days. Super strong drinks (love the absolut ruby red & ginger ale), fun crowd, good movies on TV, and a small dance floor in the back. And an overabundance of men in all shapes, sizes, and ages. Buffet time!
author: Devon S.

description:
My friend Melissa picked R Bar as the venue for celebrating her b'day.  The high ceilings, skylights, tumbling vines, mirrors garlanded with sweet-smelling pine and the warm.

The patrons that night were quite obviously. I'm not sure if this is the norm. Someone told me that the crowd is usually much posher ...

Drinks are expensive but boozy (not quite worth the money but at least the markup isn't as enormous as it could be). 

Overall great time .. not because of the place... because of great friends.
author: vivek k.

description:
I lost my bra here once and ended up with a fake monkey tattoo on my forearm.


4 triumphant stars for class.
author: Rachel G.

description:
Hey, R Bar, how about turning the music down JUST a bit.

This is a great place to grab a drink and the crowd is really fun, but the music is just so damn loud.  I wish I could stand the high decibels of a frat house as I once did, but I guess my ears are just not up to par. I can stand loud music, but for some reason, it sounds particularly loud in this bar.

The bar itself is great, located off of Polk, and the bartenders get to you pretty quickly which is always a plus. A very mixed crowd with the jeans and shirts, mingled in with the coats and ties. But I guess that's what makes SF, SF.
author: Mike K.

description:
Be nice to the Todd.
Don't yell at the Todd.
Take care of the Todd.
If you give the Todd crap, be prepared to get a mouth full of crap to eat in return.

Todd is one of the owners of this drinking establishment.  He does a great job of keeping the atmosphere positive, lively and fun.  The drinks are affordable.  There is always a good mix of folks to socialize with regardless of the day of the week.  There is a bit too much of the Marina influx on Fridays and Saturdays but don't hold that against the bar.  If nothing good sports-wise is on TV, then they will throw in a movie to keep things interesting.  When the destination is Polk street this is a mandatory stop.

So do us a favor and don't piss off the Todd.  Thanks.
author: Richard R.

description:
This is an extension of Autzen Stadium in Eugene, Oregon, a.k.a. the football stadium of the University of Oregon Ducks, and/or, depending on the season, an extension of MacArthur Court during basketball season.

The owners are kind of keen on the Oregon Ducks. They "fancy" the Ducks.

For that- 5 STARS!!!! :o)
author: Braden B.

description:
HEY WHAT'S UP??

NOT MUCH, WHAT'S UP WITH YOU? 

HUM, NOTHING, ...

....

WHAT'S YOUR NAME??

WHAT??

WHAT'S YOUR NAME??

WHAT???

that pretty much summarize it...this bar is FREAKING LOUD!!!  hard to keep up with any conversations. if a conversation is worth it, at all. it's cool if you're with your friend, but people i met there seemed to always be quite of snob-ish and interested in empty talks.  however, there is a mixed crowd hangin at the R. some young upper class professional light headed mingle with some more down to earth kids. 

friendly staff, and even if the music will lead to hearing loss, it is good muzak. 

and it's within a block of like 5 other 'hipster' bars, so good location for a cheesy pub crawl on thursday nites. thus the xtra star.
author: Margie B.

description:
Wow, I am blown away that I have never reviewed R Bar.  I live a few blocks away and have been many times.  A cool place to come and check out.  The people who own the place work there much of the time and are always really cool.  On the weekends R Bar can become super crowded (sometimes w/ a large male %) and ridiculously hot during summer with no ventilation of any kind, i don't even think they have a fan in that bitch.  If you are a Oregon Duck fan they usually have the flag hanging out there on football game days, and the place is packed.  They also the have the MLB package too and is a great option for me to come down and catch the Cubs. 

R Bar can have a very different scene from one day to the next.
author: Tom K.

description:
In answer to Patrick G.'s estimation regarding 22 year olds and the discovery of "alcohol", I have to say to him that, yes, he is correct in his outside assessment of this establishment.  I remember back in 2002 when this place used to be called "An Sibin", a laid-back Irish DJ bar that encouraged local DJ's to come on in and practice their spinning in a leisurely, friendly and grown-up pub atmosphere with paintings of little sprites and gnomes and faeries adorning the walls with a low-ceilinged back room with black-painted walls and some great freaking music.  Whatta spot it was.

What is it now, exactly?  I have no freaking idea.  I've been there four times in the last two years (all under some kind of duress:  "Where you going?"  "R Bar."  "Oh, really?"  "Yep." (under breath)"Fuck."), and I just don't understand the appeal of this claustrophobic clusterfuck that is festering in the Polk Gulch neighborhood.  

It's packed.  It's hot.  It's nearly impossible to get from Point A to Point B.  It's full of Marina-types who, as stated above, seem to have just discovered that alcohol will make you feel all giddy and funny and loud and pretty obnoxious.  Their jukebox is OK, but frankly I don't trust the taste of the clientele here.

Marina in the Tenderloin.  *shudder*  Just shouldn't happen.  Just shouldn't happen.  Sorry, R Bar.  I knew An Sibin.  I've served some time with An Sibin.  And YOU, sir, are no An Sibin.
author: Thomas B.

description:
What's with this place???...I can't seem to ever remember the leaving part of the night!

Perhaps it's the cheap and stiffy drinks and great bartenders that never make you wait for a drink.  It's not the nicest bar, but I love dive bars. I know I'm always guaranteed to have a good time if I end up at R Bar with my friends.
author: Susan P.

description:
My roomie refuses to come here with me anymore dubbing this place as a guaranteed sausage fest and dive bar. I, on the other hand, love it for all of those reasons as well as the cool, relaxed vibe, owners Chris and Todd and of course -  the jukebox. 

No matter what night it is, it's def one of those places that you will never leave sober ; ) The staff here has mastered the art of hospitality and just plain ol' fun.
author: Charlene A.

description:
I'm sad to see people raggin on this place. The bartenders--Rick and Chris are the ones I've befriended--are wonderful and attentive. And if you're there often enough you may get a free drink or two, especially if it's a slow night. Also, they typically keep a pack of cigarettes open for patrons behind the bar for those occasional only-smoke-when-I-drink-smokers. The jukebox is stocked with a great selection of modern and classic songs, and if it's a slow night, the bartender will let you pick out songs.

But of course, the weekend comes and the place turns to a Marina sausage fest ...it's true. But i'm not holding two nights a week against my bar. If you want to get a real feel for this place, go on a Wednesday night. They open at 6.
author: Lara L.

description:
2 Dollar Olympia's in the can.

Constantly give out R Bar Coozies to keep your beer cold.

Oregon Duck Football.

This place is a Win.
author: gabe r.

description: soooo there's good things and bad things about r bar.  I'm feeling kind as I write this so let me focus on the random mixed cds in the juke box.  Explore them. Treat yourself to 18 songs for five dollars as you sip your first drink.  It will keep your eyes away from the scary cabby painting on the wall.
author: Sasha W.

description:
Why do I give this dive bar 5 stars?  One reason: The University of Oregon Ducks

According to Urban Legend this place is owned by a Duck or maybe it just happened that a posse of Ducks decided to start coming here for football and basketball games and they stated a trend.  

Either way, it doesn't matter.

When the Ducks are on TV, this place is packed with Green and Yellow (the thought almost brings a tear to my eye) and the atmosphere is...loud? boisterous? crazy? ridiculous?  Drunk?      Yes.

It doesn't matter if the Ducks are losing, it doesn't matter if you didn't go to The Best College Ever...I'll bet you a punch in the face that everyone here is in such a charged, celebratory mood that you can't help but enjoy yourself.  Worth checking out.

If you're looking for a review of this place for when there's not a Duck game on, well you've come to the wrong place...
author: Carl B.

description:
I so wish I could take the weekend crowd that comes to this bar and move it to another location!  

Because this is a really GREAT bar with the BEST bartenders, who are fun, funny, friendly, and  really good at what they do.  The kind of guys who remember you, your name, your drink, and the (self-described) funny annecdote you amused them with during your last visit. 

I just learned (after coming here for 5 years) that while they don't offer food, you can order in such neigboorhood treats as nachos and sub sandwiches.  Or you can be highbrow like me and spring for a tube of Pizza-liscious Pringles from the corner store.  They don't mind.

The drinks are strong and plentiful.  The decor is not trendy at all (although they do have "art" now - that's new) - but this is a bar, not trying to be a lounge or a club, it's about the drinkin'.

Yes, sometimes it reminds me of bars I went to in college. But...I liked the bars I went to in college!   So is that bad?
author: Liz S.

description:
Why do I always forget about this place? I guess I spend too much time on the Northern side of Polk Street...and I need to change that immediately!

Great things seem to come in pairs...just like the NStar and Shanghai Kelly's, R Bar is in cohoots with Pier 23. Usually if you love one, you'll love the other.

I rolled into R Bar last night with some lady friends and we had a blast. The drinks are decently priced, the bartenders are good looking and friendly, the patrons are chill, and they play awesome music. Also, for those of you who know me well, it's a Fernet bar!! They are the number one buyer of Fernet in the nation! That's crazy. 

Long story short, don't be caught of guard by the somewhat seedy neighborhood...just pretend to be on your cell phone (am I the only one who does this??) and walk briskly down Polk and make a turn at Sutter. It's worth it....trust me.
author: Lynsey C.

description:
Always have a good time at R Bar. Good selection of music to keep your head nodding, vocal chords blaring or body wriggling. Crowd gets packed in near the door, just push on through and find some space in the back. And find video games and refuge in the super secret vip room to the right of the bathrooms. Can actually find a place to sit and not yell talk.

Drinks are inexpensive ($15 minimum on using plastic) and strong. High brow with some top ish hangar one shelf vodka or knock back cans of Olympia beer. Bartenders will drink up with you too if you ask nicely.
author: Ryan G.

description:
I go to R Bar because I know exactly what I'm going to get. I'm going to get my favorite beverage of the moment: Absolut Ruby Red and soda for a measly $6 and it is going to be all absolut with a splash of soda. I'm going to get sh*@ housed after 2 drinks and cozy up to the awesome juke box that they have in the back. I'm going to get chatted up by a lot of random dudes and I'm going to leave by 11pm when it gets so overly crowded that I can't move. Can someone enlighten me as to why there are so many Euros and foreigners that frequent this joint? It never fails, I always meet someone there from halfway around the world. 

I started the night off there yesterday at around 9:30pm. In my humble opinion, it's the best time to go. Get there before the masses do. Get in a few solid drinks and move on. 

Can I just say that last night was the most entertaining experience I've ever had there? I was on my way out when I caught 2 guys giving each other the Brandon Walsh/Steve Sanders split eyebrow shake. You know I love me some nine-o. I'm tempted to give them another star for playing "Dazed and Confused" on the telly last night. "That's what I love about them high school girls. I keep getting older and they stay the same age".
author: Jenny S.

description:
It never seems to look and feel complete. There is something missing. They can really utilize the space a lot better.

With that said, I always have fun at R Bar. The bartenders are really nice and they serve cocktails.

The location is on the verge of EEKS!
author: Dee C.

description:
A Yankees and a BoSox working together behind a bar?  Nothing is impossible.
Looking for a spot for when you tire of the hoity toity, scenesters? 

Come to this cozy nook full of drunk lads and lass's (usually after midnight). It's art school kids, service industry and regular visitors who hate the Redwood Room, all looking to hook up.

And if you like that God-awful Fernet, this is definintely the spot to satisfy such masochistic cravings.

Me?  I love the people-watching here and the jukebox.
author: Joyhan S.

description:
Local bars always rock..good selections in the juke box, we came here on our Pub Crawl last weekend too...the double vodka cran I had was more like a triple, but I'm not complaining!

I was only there for 1 our but had a good time maybe it was just because I was there with really cool people from my club!?
author: Jennifer T.

description:
JOCKS 'R' US

I actually had a guy invite me to his gun show.  WOW, really?  

Loud and crowded with white folk from the Marina.

I can't say I hate this place, but I can say that I will never come here by my own decision.  I'd rather be at the Hemlock around the corner.
author: Christina S.

description:
Sweet! Not a "scene," just a chill place to get cheap beer without a hassle. The bartenders are amazingly efficient--  tall can Coors Light with no delay, even thought the place was absolutely packed. 

Plus, I always seem to meet really interesting people at the old R bar. Good music, good folks, good times. Rock on, R Bar.
author: Nick K.

description:
I have to give it four stars because I have spent more time there then I have on my own toilet, but I would never never visit my second home on a weekend (see other reviews for reference).

Things that have happened at R bar:

1. I received the nickname of "Jennifernet" and will get poured a shot of my favorite stuff that tastes like shoe polish the minute I walk in. 
2. I was followed home by a Mongolian (a real one!) and had to duck into the corner store to be saved.
3. Got my first Harley ride from some patrons that I met there. Yes, I had had Fernet first to agree to this.
4. Was picked up by a 24 year old (if they go after me am I cougar or is it just if I go after them?) who told me he would hate me "like forever" because I wouldn't take him home.

See all the fun you have been missin'? Not only that, if you are a guy you can stumble out an get a "happy ending" next door at the massage place if the ladies at R bar aren't willing.  They usually are though.
author: Jennifer s.

description:
I dont come here for the football, I dont even like football, where is Oregon anyway? 
I've been going here for a year and half or so. Always a good time.
Its packed on weekends, so i tend to stay away.
Cool bartenders (Chris and Todd), good cheap drinks. Nice music.
Horribly ugly paintings. I love it.
Always packed.

If you're a smoker, and you're standing on the street outside, be prepared to get propositioned by tranny hookers.
Once i was even offered to purchase heroin from one. quite the package deal (pun intended)
author: Johan M.

description:
Dark.  Crowded.  

Supposedly a dance floor, which I never saw because the drinks that I was getting handed to me every five minutes distracted me.  

Cute guys plus hot girls plus dark crowded bar = great time for all.  

Even though I have a boyfriend, it's still fun to watch everyone else hook up.  The guy to girl ratio here is in favor of the ladies.  Yeah, sausage fest 2008!
author: Denise B.

description:
Not too crowded for a Friday night, which was refreshing for that part of town. The crowd was also really laid back. We found a nook in the back - there was an entire room adjacent to the dance floor that was untouched and empty, so (fantastically) the group of 6 of us got to sit down and actually talk and drink. Bartender makes a good Alabama Slamma' and was really friendly.. :)

I would add this to a good juke list if I knew of said list to be in existence...
author: Annie T.

description: I'd actually award 3.6 stars which rounds up to 4. :) (ou)R Bar is a fun, chill bar near Polk Street. I've met some really fun people here and enjoyed many Blue Moon's (though they often have only lemons and not oranges for the garnish...). I don't feel strange showing up in any type of crazy costume either as this bar is not-too-fancy and seems ready for anything. The juke box provides good times as well! You might have a little trouble finding R Bar because it's only subtly marked but you should definitely give it a try!
author: Meghan P.

description:
kinda icky.  
The barstaff are probably very nice, the customers are like nails on a chalkboard.
author: Flemm F.

description:
Your average upper echelon dive bar.  The drinks are cheap and the toilet's clean.  They have the NFL Sunday Ticket.  A good day and weekday night crowd.

On any given day, the bartender's the drunkest person in there.  That's right, on occasion I drink during the day.
author: Scott W.

description:
Excessive salmon-colored shirts.
Excessive Abercrombie hats.
Excessive high-fives.

Thats right - Bro Central.  Marina part deux.

But they got Too $hort on the jukebox and I once dropped a shot of Fernet into the Ginger back thinking I was taking a Jager bomb - causing me to hurl out front.

Good times.
author: Ryan R.

description:
7x7 Big Eat List: #71 Fernet Shot

Oh R Bar, where do I begin to count the ways of how I love thee?  When I used to live on Polk, this was one of my regular haunts.  Chris is awesome, all the other bartenders are awesome, and well... AWESOME.

Had many memorable moments that due to blackout I don't remember.  Luckily, there are many pictures to prove things actually did happen.

I don't really have much else to rave about R Bar because to me, it's just one of my bars.  It feels like home when I walk in, everyone who goes is out to have a good time, and the fernet shots are disgusting but the company is fantabulous!
author: Melissa L.

description:
I always seem to end up here, even before i found out it was a Jets bar for Sunday football. It's totally a hole in the wall but I always seems to have fun. Things I love about R Bar:

1. relaxed atmosphere but always a fun crowd
2. good variety on the jukebox - although you should be warned it takes forever for your song to play if it's a crowded night. 
3. J-E-T-S Jets Jets Jets! I was pumped to find a Jets bar in SF. 
4. Bartenders are super nice

I take away one star cuz the bathroom is kind of grimy- but it's a dive so I don't take away too much.
author: Lindsay A.

description:
My boyfriend and his LP (Life Partner) LOVE this place...
Me? 

Not so much.
