It gets SO crowded, hot and sweaty in there I can't stand it... supposedly if you go there for HH it's pretty fun, but since I work in SOMA I haven't been able to get there early enough.

But don't listen to me... they go there at least once a week and can never get enough.
author: Nenette Y.

description:
This is the bar that my other favorite bars want to be when they grow up. 

Great music. 

Cold cheap beer.

Lots and lots of shots and shots.

People are there to drink, chat, dance, laugh, and drink some more.

Bartenders either remember exactly who you are every time, or are happy to fake it, and you'll never know the difference.

It's like this: if you bring someone here and they don't like it, they don't like fun. 

Caveat: gets very full and steamy late on Friday and Saturday. So if you don't like crowds, go any other time, but be prepared cos I swear one time when I was here I heard a booming bass line, a low voice growl "oh... yeah..." and the out of nowhere, Duff Man burst on the scene with the Duff girls and asked who was ready to get Duffed!
author: Brock D.

description:
Say what you will about the R Bar, but it might be the only place to consistently meet attractive available women in the TenderNob. The Bartender is cool, the door guy is cool too. The jukebox blows, but I'm guessing if you're at R Bar, you aren't here to listen to music. Drop by R Bar at 1:45, because at two, everyone is scrambling to find someone who wants to go to an afterhours, or back to their place.  "Do you girls want to come hang out at my place? I've got some drinks, and good music if you're interested." 

I'm not trying to be sleazy, just 22 and single.
author: Dan M.

description: What makes it for me with any bar is the service.  R bar has excellent people, especially Ed and Ethan.  True professionals.
author: Jeanne B.

description:
Ugh, with a side of ugh.  I have to pass by this hole to get to my apt. every day and usually it is blaring Dave Matthews Band or some other crap while sketchy frat-types hang out in front and check out every girl that walks by.  Even with their beyond-wasted Marina girls in tow.  "Oh my God, so he said that he wanted to break up with me and I was like, oh my God..." 

No one attractive ever hangs out in front of that bar--ever. 

Once, I heard some Sabbath blaring (without the requisite "ironic" singing along that accompanies any older, metal/rock track that someone puts on) so I decided it might be safe--the bartender might be cool and put some Sabbath on.  I really needed a drink (crap day) and Lush was packed, so I chanced it.  Bartender was really nice and my beer was cheap and cold, but the bar slowly started to fill with the Dave Matthews types so I pounded it and got out while I could.  I made it out without rolling my eyes...but just barely.

*****Second time is not the Charm 6/1*****
I feel bad about this considering how nice the bartender and doorguy are...but I went again out of curiousity last night when it was packed and it sucked royally.  My friend and I were trying to figure out the crowd.  I mean you can sum it up in one word: douchebags. But, it seems like it is a mix of students, frat boys, average dumpy girls, and weird older, business guys trying to get laid.  I feel bad for the staff as they seem cool and it is not their fault about the crowd but still: UGH!
author: MakeUp M.

description: R Bar is one of my favorite neighborhood bars in SF.  Located right off of Polk, the place is always filled with friendly people and good music.  The best part of the bar is the backroom with lots of space to sit with your friends and just talk.  Plus, there's also the best game ever - Big Buck Hunter to keep you occupied.  Always a good time.
author: Karen T.

description:
I'd love to give these guys six stars, but due to the shitty crowd on the weekends, I have to knock it down to five. It's ok, the owners, bartenders and doorguys are all great people and it really is a great place to hang out Sunday through Wednesday. During those nights its primarily a place where everybody knows your name and most of the crowd is industry folk. Yes, when all the marina bro's and ho's aren't slummin' it up in the 'loin on the weekends, this place is a rad little psuedo-dive to get trashed with your favorite bartenders and friends. 

Oh yeah, this place introduced me to the fastastically disgusting guilty pleasure that is Fernet-Branca. And for that I give the R Bar both a 'thank you' and a 'fuck you' depending on my previous night's activities. But I'm sure I'll always be back for more. 

Oh yeah, and one more note, if you fellas can ever sneak into the ladies room, there is a great piece of literature all about the 'guys in the striped shirts'.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Don't be hatin' the R-bar.  Maybe I like it cause I myself am a drunken ex-frat boy who is 25 going on 17!  Hahah oh well.

The other reviewers are right--it's way too loud and crowded on Friday and Saturday, but it is actually a pretty nice place inside even though the facade is all crappy.

Plus my drunk ass left my jacket and cell phone there the other night.  They had it and didn't even 86 me after I did (???) the night before.

There's a great review of "Under the Tuscan Sun" in the men's crapper.
author: Rocco B.

description:
I don't know what it is about this place that brings me back time and time again. It's rather simple, rather dingy, and rather lacking of anything resembling decor...but the drinks are strong, the vibe hot, and always full of people that are there to have fun. 
R Bar has become quite the "industry" bar, so I often run into some of my favorite chefs and servers later in the night, usually about the time I've happily been overserved.
Last night they were showing "Captain America" on the screens, we were drinking Fernet and having a great time in a packed bar at midnight on a Sunday...good times.
author: Jason D.

description:
ERIC! Lets take a shot!!!

::insert rum punch::

ERIC!!! LETS TAKE ANOTHER SHOT!!!!

::insert two rum punches::

To friend..."I don't think the bartendar likes me"
Friend "Why"
"My shot is only half full"
"No hunny, that just means that he's tired of being yelled at..."
"Oh..."

ERIC!!! FILL MY SHOT UP ASSHOLE!!!!!

Stumble Home.
Just another night at R Bar...
author: Stacy L.

description: This place is so random but such a good time. Drinks are strong, bartenders are attentive and the crowd is very diverse and friendly! We made instant friends with a ton of people that night, which can be a bad thing if you just want to be left alone I guess. It was pretty crowded but not overcrowded to the point of feeling like you were ass to elbows or anything. Located in a slightly seedy area but once inside you'll forget all about that.
author: Rhonda G.

description:
R Bar  = drunkards. 

R Bar = crowded.

R Bar = debauchery.

Wasted + not claustrophobic + feeling slutty = good times at R Bar.
author: Ava S.

description: The DJ is a CD player spinning the Cost Plus World Market in-store soundtrack, but with 5-10 second pauses between songs.
author: Kevin L.

description:
My first impression of R Bar was when my new roommates at the time told me if i live in SF i HAVE to go to R Bar and will love it! I met up one night and next thing i new they were shoving a shot in my direction and said i HAD to take it haha.. hesitant i tried to get more info out of them but they just said its fernet and its initiation for R Bar 1st timers, oh man.. it was awful haha, my description then was tasting of rotten earth and black liquorice ;) well I'm pleased to say it is an acquired taste and i am quite fond of it now. You can not go to R Bar without ordering a shot of fernet or 2 to 3 haha (with ginger back)! 

Since my first encounter with both R bar and fernet i have returned to both many times.. they are now a part of me and i love them both haha. I was so pleased to see a shot of fernet was on the big eats SF, its definitely a SF thing and deserves to be on there! 

R Bar is just a great spot to come with friends for a laid back fun night of drinks...
author: Barbara C.

description:
So I have to admit it, I've succumbed to the "if it's not in my hood and don't really need to  go there" syndrome. I live in the lower haight and I like it there. The bars are purty chill and usually the crowd make up is mostly local. Every now and again you get some "bridge and tunnel" folk coming in to the 'hood, probably cause they read about it on yelp ;-)

Any who, my friend lives in the "Tender Nob." Uh, you just said "Nob, Beavis!"  We talked about grabbing some food and seeing as I was driving home from work, I just rolled straight to his hood. Hmm....I'm not used to the inner city. There's a lot going on. Different, Mikey likes it!

So we roll to Osha for dinner, but that's a whole nother review ;-) After dinner we rolled to the R Bar 'cause I told m friend I wanted some thang kinda low key and divey. 

R Bar is purfect. Drinks are good. Bartenders are not dicks, they are nice in fact. The crowd was good albeit a bit male dominated.  The jukebox was bumping some good tunes although I put money in and my songs came out in a strange order and really, really spaced apart....this is good I guess. I hate when people totally monopolize the juke.

Oh yea...delicious vodka gimlet! Fresh lime juice...yum!
author: isaias J.

description:
EDIT 7/06: I walked through R Bar last night and felt a strong frat party, someone is going to roofie my drink, who just grabbed my ass vibe.  Needless to say I got the hell out.  

_________

Contrary to other reviews here, I felt like there was an overabundance of 30-something, white, live in nob hill patrons at R Bar (no offense y'all, it's just not my thing).  Also, it seems really well-lit, and after several hours of drinking & dancing I don't really think anyone needs to see anyone else that clearly.
author: Katie S.

description:
I don't care for this bar as much as my friends but I do dig their hot bartender.  I also got some ass the night I was there so what am I complaining about?  

Oh yeah, this is before I got mugged by a homeless man in the Tenderloin.  He took a bottle of my Bordeaux!
author: Shiho F.

description:
I love this bar.  I've been here like 6 times and have absolutely no memory of it what so ever.

None.

Minus one star for ... I'm not sure what but I'm suspicious of a bar that I never think to go to when I'm sober, but always end up at when I'm already drunk and in the hood.
author: Cosmolicious L.

description:
Hooray for R Bar.

I have been going there for years, and always have a good time. Tonight, we had a fun time chatting with Eric and people watching. Can't beat it.

This type of review is what happens when one drinks and Yelps.
author: Annie F.

description: Want to talk about my favorite bar in the city.... This is the place! Nothing like having a neighborhood joint with the best bartenders in the City! Ed, Wills, Ethan, Chris, Tod, And Eric you are awesome! Some of my greatest friends I have met while hanging out at R.
author: Deb B.

description:
I really wish I could give this place more then 5 stars.

I went there for the first time today to watch the oregon (sadly we lost). It was great to see so many Ducks in one place. It really did feel like I was back at Autzen. 

I will be sure to go back to this place more.
author: Andre L.

description: dive bar with a small crowd on a thursday... but thats what we wanted
author: Kurt C.

description: If you're a Ducks or NY Jets fans, this is the place to hang out and have a drink. Tucked away in the heart of the city, it's a typical sidewalk SF bar with enough big screen TV's to see the game.  Locally owned by two Oregon alums, this is a just a great neighborhood bar in SF where you can meet up with your fellow sports fans in this primary Oregon Duck and Jet fan destination spot.  Great drinks and beer.  Keep in mind though if you want food you'll have to bring it in from one the many surrounding eateries.  Team jerseys mandatory!
author: Marti B.

description:
Always a good time.  On its face there is no reason why I would go into this place.  Total dive bar...generally get the sense that every dbag not hanging out at bar non are at rbar.  yet for some reason I love rbar......

Cheap drinks, bartenders always bring there "A" game
author: Solbiato S.

description:
I will always love this bar. It's all about the people and it's all about the booze. Simple. brilliant. tequila. happy. it lends itself to certain level of innocence, like getting wasted every day is a-ok. And I like that...
Yeah. I Like it like that.
author: Tini I.

description:
Sometimes, in the winter, when they keep the front doors open, it gets a little cold at R Bar.

That's just about the only thing I can think of that I don't enjoy.

It's dark, gets crowded, the jukebox is stellar, and the service fast and furious. This bar it a lot of fun, once you get down to the level.

Go Ducks? Go Ducks!
author: kainoa r.

description:
Located right at the corner of sutter and polk, I've rode the bus by the place 100 times and never noticed it.  Finally, I went in for an after work drink.  This place rocks. 

It opens at 6pm except fridays when it opens at 4pm.  We opened the bar.  Chris, the bartender and part owner, was super nice and friendly.  Made me a very strong vodka tonic and stuck around to chat a bit about sports and stuff.  As the hours went by, a few more people came through and he was just as attentive and nice.  Adorable too!

As a local bar for after work, I highly recommend this place.  It is a little dark inside, but the seats and bar were totally clean.  The bathroom (at least to start the night out) was clean as well.  I haven't been on the weekend but will definitely put it on my list.
author: Emily G.

description: If u r a ducks fan in San Francisco there is no better place to spend your Saturday.
author: Sarah P.

description:
I felt the need to review this place since I've been here 2 weeks straight and twice in one night...

The good things:
1. Cheap drinks
2. No cover
3. Interesting people watching
4. Good music (at times)
5. Great place to meet some cute folks

The bad things:
1. It is beyond PACKED!
2. One bathroom stall for girls (And don't try using the mens, it's only urinals. Trust me, I've tried...ugh)
3.The music playlist is random - get some hip hop in there so people can get their groove on!

If R Bar is too packed, go to Blur just around the corner. You can always come back when the crowd has died down a bit.
author: Josephine H.

description:
5 stars for:

Thursday nights.
Cheap drinks & fatty shots (rock glass filled to da rim).
Hip hop to rock, great selection of music.
People are ready to mingle.
author: Anna S.

description: Overrated. This is my boy's favorite spot but I have no luck there. Its like the girl that you really want things to work out with. You just keep trying but one thing or another just reminds you this ain't the one.   I could go into way more detail with specific incidents but I think it just best to walk away and leave you to your kind.
author: Dru P.

description:
You know, it is true that there is a certain element of the insufferable Cow Hollow types who flock to R Bar.  

They do arrive at the door with major entitlement attitude, but, once you have a few beers and perhaps some Fernet or other shot, the fact that they are bellowing to each other seems to fade.....away.

But, that said, the bartenders are truly, truly, truly stellar fellas.  I ALWAYS have fun at R Bar, and I am a gay guy in his mid-thirties.

Go figure!

I think the bar is most fun based on the types of people you're not expecting to see there.
author: Jim K.

description:
I love this bar because it's stumbling distance to where I live, the bartenders are sweet and the jukebox is packed with goodies. Nice place to sit with a group of friends, drink and shoot the shit. Also a good place to watch a game if you don't mind the small tvs. The crowd is fairly young and there's usually a few hotties in the bunch. Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays are the best nights to go. They take credit card but just remember to close your tab...I never do ;P  

Another bouns - There's a good burrito place a couple doors down where you can grab some grub to soak up the alcohol.
author: Erin H.

description:
Started coming out to this bar a few weeks ago to catch NY Jets games which I can't get at any bars in Berkeley.  This place has an excellent atmosphere and really place FUN to watch football, they have 4 tvs spread out through the bar, each showing a different game.   

They have $3 Newcastles on tap on Sundays and the bar tenders are really friendly and  are cool with people bringing food in from the outside or even ordering food to be delivered to the bar, since they don't serve food.
author: Neal S.

description:
Me: 4 drinks deep from Valleywag happy hour.
Everyone else: Drinking like it's they're last day on Earth/already passed out on a back couch.

"If there were a fire in here, we'd all be dead, no questions asked." - Lindsay S.

Note to self: pre-game, no, BIG game before heading here next time.  Maybe that'll help...
author: Erika C.

description:
I only give R Bar one star because and only because of the bald bouncer at the door. SOOOO F***** RUDE!  So rude that my party of 15 i brought for business left at the door and didnt give 2 shits about going inside after that. It was my 21st birthday and he mad some rude comment about that too. 

I cant rate the bar or the other staff inside but i cant say that i wouldn't even consider going back because of Mr. Power hungry at the door. Your a bouncer for god sake? What makes you so cool? Loser.
author: Becky R.

description:
I walk into the bar.  Dude grabs me and starts dancing with me.

Dude: Hey you're pretty good
Me: Thanks

Note that this is pretty much in front of the door.

Dude continues dancing with me and I kind of turn to leave to follow my friends.

Dude: Hey where are you going?
Me: My friends I think are trying to go to the back
Dude: Well come dance with me later.  You're good!

I always appreciate being told that :)

However some girl comes up an grabs him.  I'm like okay, girlfriend.  Fair enough.  Where are my friends?

Girlfriend is trying to keep him close.  Dude keeps grabbing me to dance with me whenever she isn't looking.  She isn't as good at booty shaking as I am so I kind of understand but still, she's your girlfriend.  Don't be an ass.

I overhear later that this is his wife.

HOT

So that along with drunk ass fucker who was falling over as he insulted my friend and the dude who grabbed me and asked where I was going as I was leaving the bar would be enough reason for me not to go back.  Reason #358 I'm not fond of dive bars.

But the bouncer was cool, they have Blue Moon on tap which makes me happy and the tunes on the juke box are pretty good.  I'm more likely to come here and have to deal with drunk jackasses and grabby boys than maintain patience with people who think they are better than me.  I'm sure the drunk jackasses are reasonably civil when the aren't drunk.  Acting like a douche when you're sober?  There is just no excuse.
author: Alexis B.

description: So I went here with friends and I just wish I could find more bars that are like this!  It's a smallish bar but that's fine with me, it wasn't too packed when we got there but by the time we left it was getting going.  The bartender was nice, friendly and cute!  If memory serves right, they had a great jukebox and that's always an important touch for me! The beers were cold and the fernet was nasty, as usual!  FFWD to us leaving and me with my head on the bar because I was so shit housed.  It was a great time, and sadly, I have the pictures to prove it!  I bucked up a little tho after my nap and carried on to a few more bars!
author: Tina H.

description:
This place is within walking distance from my house, which when I think about it it's a bit scary. If it's within walking distance I'll try it out at least once. 

Unfortunately for me the drinks are cheap and I just keep going back for more. There have been many a night when I stumbled home from good old R Bar. 

I'm not an alcoholic I swear! I just like to get the occasional drink
author: Sarah W.

description: From the number of TVs in the bar, you might think that this place is a sports bar, but the vibe is really not like most sports bars most of the time. The bar proper has a fantastic selection (who ever heart of a bar with that many kinds of rye?) and decent prices (for Nob Hill area, at least). It can turn a bit bro-ish at times, but it's a decent enough place. Compared to the other bars in the area, which are either overpriced Nob HIll bars or clubby/sketchy lower Polk bars, R is a nice place to have a drink. Or four.
author: James B.

description:
I haven't been here since a birthday party in March, but I was reading another review, and felt inspired to send my own. 

I like R bar. I always seem to run into lawyers there.

I also always seem to get extremely drunk there. 

Minus one star, because I have never felt like I could just go there in PJs.. It is kinda a very Yuppie place.
author: Danielle V.

description:
I don't like Coors Light. At all. I like cheap beer, just not that one. I do like, however, bars that sell Coors Light tall cans and serve them with sip sac's (corporatized coozies). 

Drinkin a tall can, hittin on chicks, alright, alright, alright.
author: Dibital N.

description:
Love the deco bar, 
Fight through the crowd butts to balls, 
Social, civil, fun.
author: Brian J.

description:
It's not Hemlock across the street, but it's still pretty damn good. I first walked into the bar two weeks ago to be greeted by the Beta Band coming out of the juke box! And people dancing!

When I recovered from my shock over the awesome music I noticed that the bar was full, but not scary full, the drinks were stiff... (so stiff I ended up dropping my last one... remind me to eat before drinking whilst watching people dance)

Awesome bar, will be back often.
author: Mckay W.

description: Dive bar, nice owner, nice folks, okay music, older crowd, and best of all net net fernet!
author: Rhea F.

description:
Management at the R-bar has done a good job of performing a delicate balancing act....the modernization an old bar without the loss of it's soul.  The old wood is still there, and the art-deco ceiling along with recessed lighting still graces the spot above the bar. Rather than subject it to a top-to-bottom remodel, it's existing decor has been spruced-up with tasteful accents that lend it a modern feel without detracting from it's history.  The result is a cozy spot with a  hip feel, and one that hasn't lost it's old-guard charm.

I sat down about 20 minutes before the start of the Kentucky derby, at around 3:00PM on an Saturday.  Two separate cultures seemed to peacefully coexist:  Marina kids towards the front of the bar, with a more sedate crowd to the rear.   I sat near the Marina kids...and they were loud.  I hadn't heard the word "fuck" so much since my last visit to Terry's Lodge in the Sunset.  Commonly repeated phrases seemed to be "dude, I was Soooooo drunk", and "That's a rad song....turn it up!!!!".  The crowd at the other end of the bar started looking more interesting, but the music got steadily louder....too loud for a neighborhood pub before 4:00 PM, and too loud for me to talk over.

Basta. Five minutes after the horse-race, I felt the need to take drastic measures: Hit the bathroom, head out the door, and in doing so leave a half-full beer at the bar.  Nice place....irritating clientele.  If it's this noisy at 3:00PM, the night-scene is probably nothing I'd feel like dealing with.
author: Mike W.

description:
Eh.....pretty much overcrowded, heomogenous crowd, way too hot (like 90 degrees in there), poor music, nothing special.  

I may have liked this place when I was 22, but now I felt old, and I'm only 30.  Its just a college bar.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Five stars because I NEVER GO ON WEEKENDS.   On Weekends, I'd bring it down to 2.  But check out WED nights with Ed and the other amazing bartenders.

They also throw really great events with local non-profits!
author: Monika M.

description:
I love it when people give bars a bad grade because they probably got shot down by girls that are out of their league or no one talked to them the whole time. Yes, I am talking about you guy with 350 yelp posts in the past 2 weeks and 650 yelp friends. 

I met Chris, one of the owner/bartenders through a friend of a friend and he is one of the nicest guys I've ever met in the business. Trust me, if you don't get along with him, it's because you're a big dickwad. 

If you wanna go someplace and look hot and hook up, go dress up as The Crow and go to satans halloween party. This place is just a good spot to listen to good music and have drinks with friends. It's not a club so don't complain about not having a great dancefloor or tons of space. That's like going to an italian restaurant and complaining when they don't have burgers, which I'm sure a bunch of idiots have done before. 

Just saddle up, order a shot of jamison, and hit up audiodub on the jukebox or next I see you there I will punch you in the testies.
author: Jeffrey V.

description:
Friday night.

Not crowded...off night?
Full of guys...good for the ladies?
Cheap Strong Drinks...good spot to stop by
Decent music and Dance floor...too bad people were just standing around.

...moving on to another bar.
author: Gladys D.

description:
Not my crowd, but two stars.
1. Right before leaving, '...Yellow Country Teeth' by Clap Your Hands Say Yeah came on, & this is one of my alltime favorite Git Amped songs.
2. The bartender gave me a shot on the house while I was closing out my tab.

Agreed with all the comments on it being a Marina transplant bar [or maybe Santa Monica?]. I went with a bunch of friends & had a great time, but it was definitely the company & not the atmosphere of this place. Plus it was just way too packed with bros & extremely self-aware girls.
author: Pete J.

description:
Without a doubt, this is the closest bar to my house. That being said, I dont really like it all that much. On the weekends it just tends to be over crowed dude-fest and generally just not that interesting. And for game days, Im talking about Oregon st, or Jets, beware. There will be belligerent fans doing things which completely allude any comprehension, on my part.

That being said there are a few redeeming qualities though. Week nights here are quite nice. There is quick service, plenty of seating, a great juke box, and well just generally good company.

If i could Id give it 2 stars for weekends, and 4 for week days.
author: Jeshua B.

description:
Cool people: rBar rocks hard.
Stuck up, pretentious people: rBar sucks monkey dung.
author: Chris R.

description:
I know many will complain that it is a meat-market in here, but this place has many pluses that many bars in the city fall short of.  
Great bartenders, Fast bartenders,  killer jukebox, and some funny shit in the bathroom.   The crowd can be mixed, its not always marina escapees.  If they could just hook up some AC and get some crowd control, then they place would be 5 stars.
author: Dan G.

description:
Jesus, I hate all the scenesters that bitch about "frat boys" or "Marina."  Get over it - this bar rocks.  The #1 volume seller of Frenet in SF (and prob the US) - it's *the* place to order Frenet shots and Ginger to chase it.  It's an acquired taste but after the first few you'll be craving it randomly, like on Tuesday afternoons.  

Hilarious "book report" (the spoils of a dare) in the mens room - ladies, it's worth sneaking in and looking over the toilet.

To the hipsters: if you're going to constantly bitch every time you see a guy in a collared shirt, then don't leave the Mission, jerks.
author: Rob K.

description:
It reminds me of a Seattle bar because:

- There are no decorations but it looks nice enough.
-  The bathrooms are surprisingly small and dingy, only room for one person.
- They serve tall boys and Hangar One vodka.
- The music is run by a juke box.
- Sometimes people dance, most of the time they don't.
- The most random mix of people from true Marina girls, butter faces, cute young guys, the emo group, and an old man who looks like a skinny Santa wearing a Hawaiian shirt.
author: Julie R.

description:
Things I enjoy: drinking a v&t in a nice heavy glass, the ability to play both lauryn hill and bloc party on the same jukebox, nice bartenders, cheap drinks, and making endless pirate jokes based off the name of a bar. This is why I like R bar.

As Jenny S. mentioned it is best to hit up after work, weekday night, or to start off a night of drunken debauchery.  After 11:00 on weekends it gets pretty crowded and filled with various tools and chicks with orange tans wearing tube tops.  So get their early chat it up with the bartenders, watch a movie, and put on some good tunes.
author: Katie M.

description:
R Bar...what can you say, it's AWESOME.  Especially during the weekend days - beat the crowds.

Bartenders are tops, patrons are good.  Fernet Branca always, unless it's a tequila day.
author: david s.

description: Place claims to be a Cleveland Browns Backers bar, so went to watch the game.  Only 1 of the 7 TVs worked.  I could forgive this, since it seemed to be Direct TVs fault (although not changing the TVs until 5 minutes before kickoff is pretty dumb).  But even when TVs were back up and running, they only gave the Browns fans - which was about 45 of the 50 people in the bar - the back 3 TVs.  And they have the ability to play audio thru the speakers, but were planning on doing audio for some other game that like 2 other people watched.  Its enough that most of the country assumes Clevelanders are second class citizens, but it shouldnt be happening at a bar that is claimed to be a Cleveland Browns bar for 3 hours on a Sunday morning.
author: Troy L.

description: The most nauseating crowd of jock meat heads one could find. Caps on backwards, swilling Coors Light. No asshole, I'm not your bro!I ..A true haunt for Marina douche bags who are feeling edgy and venturing out...
author: Tim E.

description:
Great Bartenders-Friendly and Fast

Great Beers-Newcastle in a bottle-THANK YOU

Great Atmosphere-I don't go there on Friday or Saturday nights, but it's a fun, low-key place to grab a beer during the week. 

Great Entertainment-Four televisions, always with a game on-and they never miss an Oregon game. GO DUCKS!
author: Leesa P.

description:
First off, I'd like to state that the first time you go to any bar and form an opinion of it, you should go on a weeknight -- preferably Monday through Wednesday. Only then can you actually check out the bar's decor, chat with the staff, take your time to check the drink selection, freely move around, etc etc. 

I FRICKIN HATE YELP REVIEWS FROM PEOPLE SAYING THAT A PLACE IS TOO CROWDED ON A FRIDAY OR SATURDAY NIGHT.

R Bar is a great bar. Chris and Todd are the bomb. They're really nice people and know how to run a good bar. They have a good drink selection, like to support the locals (I know Chris is from SF), and all around get props.

Why are you people penalizing them for their success? I don't understand it. It's not their fault that it's crowded on the weekend. After all, you're there only adding to the crowd. What are they supposed to do? Start pissing everyone off so that they no longer get business and close down? It's ok to mention that the bar was crowded in your review, but don't knock the place because of it.

Having said that, I never go to R Bar on the weekends. I just don't. During the week, sure I'll drop in a few times. Here's an IM transcript after a weekday R Bar visit:

it was basically me and Chris (the bartender)
and a few others popping in and out
but we shot the shit all night and every half hour it seemed, he gave me a shot
and we ran the whole gamut
tequila, bourbon, jager, vodka, etc
next time I'll just have to politely decline
i got up to leave and was like wtf i'm hammered
hendrix in between rounds of shots
i only meant to go in for a drink or two
he was bored. slow monday.
so i got free shots
it got ugly quickly
author: Richard H.

description:
This bar is fun, if you're in the right mood for it.  In fact, it's best when you've already warmed up somewhere else!  Fun thing is, it's totally your college bar, just a bit more grown up (they sell Olympia in a can.  How awesome is that?)

It would probably get 3.5 stars from me...if that was an option...but the fact that they are die-hard Ducks fans easily makes it 4!
author: Louis M.

description:
I really like this bar.  

Its teeny tiny but sometimes its worth it.  And a lot of time its not packed (unless there's an Oregon game on)

The staff is really nice and the drinks are cheap.  The bathrooms are pretty nasty.

The owners are U of Oregon alum so during games its packed with the green and gold (or is it yellow?)  Try to avoid it on those days.  The fans are fun and friendly but if you don't share the Oregon love it can be overwhelming.
author: Angela S.

description:
The only place i know where Sunday's can turn into Thursday nights at the bar.  The bar gets pretty packed for such a small place.  The drinks are plentiful ($2 dollar beers) and the crowds are awesome.  

One night a limo was parked outside and that just brought girls in like a moth to a flame.  It was hilarious seeing guys trying to claim it was their limo when in fact it was just some driver coming in looking for directions and deciding to stay longer by ordering a couple of drinks.  (Good choice to drink a drive buddy!!)

The coolest thing about this place is the bathroom.  They have stories and jokes for you to read as you do your business.  (5 stars for the bathroom!)
author: Bernardo C.

description:
Apparently the first 3 times I was here I was too blacked out to realize how much fun it was!

Get here to start your night...enjoy some cocktails and shots and maybe catch the end of the game...

Great meeting spot.
author: Ken S.

description:
I like this bar...no, i love this bar!  i've always had a kickass time everytime i've gone in.

weekends are tough tho...minus one star.

i'm really excited now that they have an automatic toliet in the girls room! I may need to reevalute the minus one star...

cheers, boys!
author: shannon s.

description:
5 stars for the two hot, HOTTTTTTT owners. 

2 stars for the lame ass men that congregate there, mostly.

4 stars for general people watching.

5 stars cuz it's always easy to get a drink even though it is always packed and hot. 

This place has quite the following. Great place for a Friday night!
author: Christina R.

description:
We stopped in to meet some friends while we were at the Polk St Fair. We had Beau in tow so they get and extra star for being dog friendly. The bar itself is OK, they have a few flat screens to watch sports and a sitting area in the back. I had no idea that this was the Oregon Duck's headquarters! Seriously, everyone was decked out in green. This one guy had face paint and custom Duck Nike's. Honestly, who does that?
The beer was a lot cheaper than the beer at the fair(of course) and you didn't have to drink it in a corral. It's not a great bar but not a destination place unless you LOVE the Ducks.
author: Douggers M.

description:
R Bar is my favorite bar in San Francisco- it wears so many hats.  During football season, it is a place that opens early and has every game (because of those crazy hours they're closed on Monday).  R Bar is also a Friday-lovin' place with an excellent jukebox.  
Great bartenders, know what you need and are quick.  Have the Fernet Branca, everyone else does.  Note the bottles decorating the bar.
Phenomenal
author: Sam L.

description: This is a bar gets mixed reviews because they like who they like. This isn't really a bar that I'd stroll into alone, but I'd go with a group of friends. These folks know each other and aren't really interested in making more friends. They have already got plenty. So it's definitely a cool bar to hang out in the back with your pals and play some tunes on the jukebox. Apparently, if you're a Ducks fan this is your HQ in the city. That's just what I've heard...
author: Stafford J.

description: Small but cool place in the TL. Back room can be reserved for parties but wow, it's really hot and stuffy back there, almost unbearable. Cool aspect though - they have Ms. PacMan and Galaga video game too. Cheap beers, they were running a $2 Olympia beer special. I've ended up here many times but never seem to remember where it's actually located. Seeing that I was sober on this occasion, maybe now I can finally remember and recommend it as a cool spot to chill.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: This is a former-frat boy bar. I would never go here as the "main course" of a bar hoping night. Its good to start with, when no one's in there and great to black out at between 12-3. Its nothing special unless you're an Oregon fan or local. Not that I'm complaining, I've yet to have a boring memory, or pieces of memories, from this place.
author: Esperanza A.

description:
This place will probably be 5 stars for a girl ;) 

good drinks, and in an out of way place on polk.  I have been to polk many times and never came across this little gem without hearing about it from friends.  Place is small and packed and there's like 5 guys for every girl.  However, it is a good place to get a drink after dinner on Polk before moving on elsewhere to get your groove on :D
author: Puchu ..

description: Went to R Bar for the first time for New Year's Eve.  The plan came together at the last minute, but so glad this is where we decided to go. Great, chill crowd. Chris and the rest of the crew were awesome. I only pass through SF once every few months now, but I'll be back here each time for sure. My Cousin Vinny was also on TV. Win. (I'm a law school nerd).
author: Art C.

description: This seems like it could be a casual place to chill, but there was nothing memorable about it. The only excitement was there was Big Buck Hunter in the back room (for $1!) but I lost pretty bad to a girl I didn't know, so I had to leave the bar in shame. Mind you, I come from cow town, so a deer shooting game should be second nature right?
author: Steven M.

description:
This place is worth going to, if for no other reason than for the amazing service of the bartenders. They're friendly, unpretentious, *fast*, and they actually serve people in the order that they sidle up to the bar, instead of playing favorites and ignoring people like so many other SF bartenders. 

The attitude of the owners/bartenders seems to set the tone of the place, and as a result the crowd is usually similarly easy-going and friendly. Can get very hot and crowded on weekend nights, but off-peak it's a great, relaxing watering hole.
author: Peter B.

description:
Does Rick still bartend here? Or is it Rob? If they do then just stay here when you get here. Either way the bartenders make this bar. It gets pretty rowdy on the weekends. Alot of older broads seem to frequent the area and there is always that one dude outside with his streetsheet, just yelling.

Dude how much is the streetsheet? Has anyone ever bought one, or can you just take it and keep walking? I am confused on that matter

Um this place does kinda suck after a while, but Rick is cool and if you like Oregon football then come here cuz they love Oregon. 

NEVER EVER make fun of the Tamale lady in this bar. If you do you will get slapped. 

Definitely an older crowd here. The potty is not bad.
author: Ash D.

description: Even though I have moved out of the neighborhood (but still in SF), this is still my favorite neighborhood bar! For me and my friends its "Our Bar" kinda like Cheers where people recognize you even on a busy night. The place gets really crowded on Friday and Saturday nights. You try and play a song on the jukebox and your lucky if you hear it before last call. The other days of the week is cool to come by and get a drink. On Sundays, you can watch football games and the Ed the bartender is really cool! Props to Chris and Todd! and Miguel is my homie!
author: Vanessa C.

description: R-Bar is like the dumping ground for Marina outcasts. In a good way. Everyone is fairly attractive and decently dressed, but surprisingly less douchey, are wearing a reasonable amount of clothing to cover their flesh, and drinks are well priced. Decent music, lively atmosphere and slight diviness all add up to good times.
author: sholeh m.

description: I'll go to R Bar for $2 olympia's sometimes. Weekends it can get kind of crowded but weeknights its a pretty cool place to grab a few beers. They usually have a movie playing on the tv's inside which is a cool touch that I don't think i've seen anywhere else.
author: Chris G.

description: The bartenders here are very much churn and burn due to the large crowds that come through. The experience here is pretty 2-star but the drinks aren't too expensive so I think it warrants a three star rating. There's nothing too special or unique about R Bar but there isn't a whole lot wrong with it either. I wouldn't come here by choice but am down to check it out on nights where friends have organized a meet-up here.
author: Tushar K.

description:
Founded by a native SF kid and his U Oregon best friend this bar is a chill getaway from most scenes (sorry transplants). I met an awesome girlfriend in here as well. Order the Olympia beer and hopefully you can score a cozy duirng a Duck game. They play the 9ers games during the season and have awesome movies on at night, not to mention many Oregon loyalties. The jukebox is thorough.
ENJOY.
author: M P.

description:
Good bartenders, good prices and no shortage of booze.  

As somebody put it , "this is a drinkers bar" and that is one thing that you will notice here, not a good place to be if you are not drinking (DD)which some of the drunkasses in the place will tell you given the chance.  

R-bar is always lively, the drinkers change on a daily schedule so if you are trying to avoid a bad night stand that you picked up there a couple nights ago you are most likely safe going right back.  

Friday and saturday can tend to be overcrowded but if thats what you are looking for this is your place.
author: S T.

description: Up Top! Woo hoo! is usually what I'm screamin' by the end of the night here.  This place is just close enough for me to crawl home after a night of Jameson shots and cans of Bud Light.  The bartenders are always in a good mood and look like they are having fun.  This place is very close to the Firehouse as well, so you can usually spot some off duty hotties relaxing.  There are usually more guys than girls here so you run the risk of meeting some douches but if you get lucky you might also meet a MAN.
author: Kimmy C.

description: im guessing this a pretty cool dive bar. i dont really go here much but i hear great things about it. i like how big it is. you can get your drink and roam around chillin. prices are pretty good and they have some pretty awesome specials. again a great bar to watch sports if thats what your looking for. never been here after dark so i dont really know how it gets at night.
author: Ashley H.

description: Polk Street barhopping extravaganzas would not be complete without hitting up R Bar. I thought I was walking into a place full of gangbangers and thugs given how this place looked from the outside with the graffiti and cage doors. Inside is actually not too bad, a good old bar packed with an eclectic crowd. Supposedly the Fernet is the drink of choice here but that stuff taste worst than the crazy Chinese elixirs where they boil every root and weed that looks interesting in a claypot.
author: Ed L.

description: Bartenders are very friendly here. Drinks are reasonably priced. I went here on a Thursday night and it was not too crowded which was good.
author: Ashley B.

description: $2 Olympia's! Nuff siad. Be careful on weekend nights because of the crowds but other than that this place pulls pretty hard.
author: Mike B.

description: R Bar is a fun place to hang. I typically stop by on Sunday nights because Ethan is by far one of my favorite bartenders, and he knows his Whiskey. They always have some hilariously old movie playing-unless of course, there is some sort of sporting event happening. The crowd is decent, typically a good mix of folks. Music is generally good, they have a jukebox.
author: Jessica S.

description: R is as plain as its name.  It's the same old setup:  dim lighting, candlelit tables, etc., etc.  But there was a lively crowd that particular weeknight.  And once you've got a few stiff ones in you, the atmosphere is almost unimportant, anyway.  Just off Polk, add R Bar to your bar hopping list.
author: Marsha Z.

description: I've never actually been inside but it seems to be full of screeching twenty-two year olds who have discovered this amazing thing called 'alcohol', maybe you've heard of it?
author: patrick g.

description: I agree with all the good reviews of R Bar! Its a great spot for after work drinks, if you are out for the whole night it really picks up and get packs. If your lucky like me you've got a good spot in the corner in-front of the video poker/game thing. Great guys i grew up with own and work it!
author: Rachel L.

description: This is one of my favorite hangouts. Great drinks, nice people and lots of Fernet. They always play great sports -- especially Pac 10. I would give them 5 stars but they are duck fans --Fight on, USC.
author: lindsey l.

description: This place is a little schizophrenic.  Some nights it's a packed pick-up kind of meat market, other nights it's a laid back place to chill after a hard day's work and enjoy a beer or two in peace.  I've yet to really find the pattern though, since it seems to randomly fluctuate between one and the other.
author: Mason G.

description:
there's nuthin too special bout this place. the design isn't outta this world, the clientele varies from weekday to weekend, the juke box is o.k.
the bartenders are what do it for me. I get sauced there inna bout an hour. I've been there a dozen times and got nice and drunky real quick. I like a bar where service is paramount and everything else after. I'd give it  4 stars if they give it a remodel, or at least a once over with some 409.
author: santiago g.

description: Didn't quite live up to its hype.  I walked in and was like, "THIS is R Bar?"  I expected so much more.  Nevertheless, my Tom Collins was a lot more Tom and a lot less Collins for only $4.  Oh, and the pictures in the men's urinal are pretty funny.  Hot chicks laughing and pointing downward.  What ever could that mean?
author: Vanessa Z.

description: R Bar gets pretty crowded on the weekends but it's always our group's first stop on Polk (or a little off of Polk actually), since all the other bars on this block have ridiculous lines and/or covers. They play fun music and it's not sooo crowded that you can't stay for a few drinks with friends. There's also a hot dog stand on some weekends right outside! The bouncer's cool and will talk to you while you stand outside on the phone/having a stoge. Pretty chill and casual vibe, and definitely a fun place to stop!
author: Janie Y.

description: I just moved to San Francisco.. and I just moved to Nob Hill, but this is one of the first bars I came to in the city.  The bartenders (especially Ted) were awesome and got us our drinks right away.  Really made us feel at home in our new neighborhood.
author: Samantha S.

description: Great bar. Awesome staff except for one prick that wanted to charge my buddy ( a regular) 40 bucks for a double don julio on the rocks. Fuck that guy- and its weird I've never been treated like a jerk before or after that night at this bar. Off night I guess. All in all a good time, lots of hot girls that are willing to play and hangout, and cool dudes for good conversation- good times.  Plus they play movies like Weird Science and Bad News Bears
author: Martin S.

description: Yep, I was the last person to leave the bar. That's totally the sign of a good night. The bathroom is nasty, but there are so many cute guys there that it makes up for it. 5 stars for cute guys, 1 star for the bathroom, 4 stars for the bartenders...somehow I think that averages out to 4 stars. I'll go back, but for sure I won't be using the potty.
author: Julie F.

description: It's fun to give the birthday boy a shot of Fernet and tell him it's Jaeger, then watch him go outside and take himself home in the middle of his celebration, minutes away from puking. Or maybe that's sad? At any rate, be prepared to be hoarse and with a little headache a morning after R Bar. But I totally agree: While I love Lower Polk, it's not a funkfest with all the Marina peeps there. And admittedly I'm one of "them."
author: Ferol G.

description: Wow, they have 'regulars' at this bar! I just thought it was just a meat market. While it's totally not my scene and most of the people that 'party yea!' here annoy me, I do find myself coming back on some random occasion. Typically when I've had it with the neighboring bars or it's too crowded everywhere else. The 80s music makes me giggle and despite everything the bartenders are pretty damn rad. A few of them are way more interested in chatting up some BLT girl who's flirting with him at the end of the bar than taking care of the thirsty masses, but that's to be expected sometimes.
author: Colleen B.

description: The music can be really good here. I am glad they renovated it. It looks a lot better! 3 stars because it's just another okay bar in the city.
author: Cannon C.

description: R Bar should be the establishment that everyone should look to as a beacon of amazingly indulgent debauchery on a reasonably balanced scale. Thank you Tod(d?), Chris, Eric, Will, Ethan and that morning dude that's always cool to us, because you make it a f'ing awesome place to celebrate and commiserate. Huzzah and cheers, R Bar, I drink to you...
author: Logan B.

description: Stopped by R bar yesterday and I can't believe that I have never seen this bar before!  The crowd was the normal polk street crowd (kick back and chill) which I love and the bartenders were cool.  Everyone seemed to be having a good time and no drama heads.  I will definitely be back for more!
author: Maria E.

description: The bartender/owners are the most patient, welcoming and gracious cats around.  I can go here alone at 1am and feel completely comfortable knowing the boys (and Jules) will take care of me.  Plus they look really geeky/cute with the long aprons on.  If you're lucky they will be wearing short pants (or "shants" as I call them - but the R Bar boys can get away with it) and their little ankles will be peeking out from underneath.  Besos, hermanos!
author: Mokirobinson M.

description: Why is it that so many men flock here - what keeps them entertained without women and sports? Every time I come here I find this place swarming with men - literally packed from front to back. So for women I would venture to say this is a good place to check out.  I never end up staying here very long because this place is too crowded to breathe on the weekends.
author: Stacy H.

description: LOVE this bar...almost always has a good crowd. The bartenders are super friendly and the drinks are totally reasonable  eek- that makes me drink more...
author: Amina B.

description: I'm stuck in between "meh" and A-ok. Although I do like the music there.
author: greg e.

description:
First time I went to R Bar, I was on a pseudo date with a Marina boy.

He was a jackass.

Second time I went to R Bar, I was celebrating my 24th.

I puked all night and all the next day.

Third time I went to R Bar, I became smitten with my new beau.

Third time's a charm!
author: Jenna F.

description: I like this place.  Not pretentious, cool bartenders, and the jukebox is off the hook.  If you hear Radiohead playing at midnight on a friday, it's because I just dumped 5 dollars in the box.
author: Tony S.

description: *oregon duck bar* cool place, no food..decent bathrooms, decent selection of beer on tap. bartenders were cuties and very nice, this place can get shoulder to shoulder fast as its only about 600 square feet. about 8 plasma tvs...nice place. not a sports bar but they always have sports on
author: Rose A.

description: A bar that doesn't try to be something it's not.  Lively, yet chill -- that's all you need.
author: Blake B.

description: University of Colorado football is having a tragically horrible year.  Therefore I've decided to become a U of Oregon groupie.  It's not an arbitrary choice, it's inspired by roomates, friends and R Bar.  When the Ducks play, this place is packed and everyone is having a good time, friendly people slammin' beers, smiling and attentively watching the game.  The bartenders rock, there's no pretense, and I've always had a great time here.  If your football team sucks too, I highly recommend just jumping on the Ducks bandwagon.  Even when they lose, everyone enjoys themselves.
author: ellyk E.

description: Noisy, crowded, generic, nondescript.  A lot of restaurant and bar people go here.  In the tenderloin but too nice to be a dive.
author: Gil S.

description: GO DUCKS!  I not a duck, but I love R Bar.  And they have $2 Olympia beers.  WITH KOOZIES!  It gets pretty crowded but the music is mostly good and the bartenders are awesome!   Great Polk st bar.
author: Lauren M.

description: Yeah, so most of my friends detest R Bar, but I kind of like it  *gasp*  My experience was based on a slow night, when we got to choose music from the jukebox and had friendly banter with the bartenders.  I will admit that there is not much by way of atmosphere here, unless you count my hair sticking to the wall behind me when I sat down.  I second Monika M. and would go on a week night.
author: CAKE E.

description: They serve champagne in your own personal plastic bottle. I love you R Bar.
author: Carson H.

description: Why is this bar special? There is NOTHING special about this bar. But for some reason it is always packed... And where there are people there is fun! It seems like a bland venue has been transformed to a popular location for that just graduated-got-my-first-job-and-I'm-going-to-drink-myself-silly crowd. I'm not judging, I wouldn't say those days are too far behind me. The cheap drinks aid in this process as well.
author: Rada I.

description: The Staff at R bar were fantastic for New years. Good crowd, staff that were not frustrated by having to work new years eve, willing to jump into the spirit of it, and very quick fast and friendly. Love this bar.
author: Laura C.

description: This is a good place for happy drunks!  It's kinda dingy, but not in a gross way.  The bar staff is very friendly, pour stiff drinks and don't give attitude.  The crowd can be slightly annoying, but not so much that you can't just block them out and enjoy yourself.
author: Emily L.

description: The crowd is slightly obnoxious and it can get crowded, but the drinks are cheap and these are some of the most attentive bartenders in town.  $2 Coors Light tall boy and a decent jukebox?  I'm in love.
author: Geoff K.

description:
After dinner, we headed over to R Bar for after dinner drinks, where Todd, the lovely owner hooked me up with some Jukebox credits and I got to play DJ, busting out an array of Johnny Cash, Radiohead and Louie Prima. As I returned from selecting the evening's music, Mikey quickly whispered, "Don't talk. Just listen."
A very drunk man at the end of the bar was regaling anyone who'd listen with his recent turn in a Thai Massage Parlor.
Um, guess what. Turns out, they really are hookers. Color me shocked.
We chuckled at his story and went back to our drinks. Later, Mikey leaned in again. "Todd's cutting him off."
Fabulous.
We looked up to find Todd handling the situation gracefully but insisting that Thai Massage Parlor had clearly "had enough today." I liked the "today" part. It implied Thai Massage Parlor probably started drinking at sunrise and would continue to do so tomorrow. That is, in between his massages.
"Oh god," sighed Mikey. "That's gotta suck. Getting cut off at 9 at night. How embarrassing."
With that, Thai Massage Parlor dramatically knocked over the huge glass of water Todd had so graciously provided for him. He stumbled back off his stool, hands in the air as if he were being arrested. "Alright, alright. I'm an asshole."
Asshole? You? Come on. Never!
He stumbled out of R Bar onto the streets of San Francisco, no doubt to go cry on the pre-pubescent shoulder of his treasured Thai Masseuse...
author: Beth S.

description: Great low-key neighborhood bar with friendly bartenders. Turns into a singles meat market on the weekends.
author: shoba d.

description: Bartenders are nice, the crowd is usually pretty cool.  But it gets way too packed on weekends... a great place to go on mid-week nights for a drink or two, but I don't get to do that much anymore now that I don't live close by.
author: Andrew E.

description:
thank you, r bar...

... for being 3 short blocks away from my house
... for making me extremely strong hangar one lime and soda's
... for having that secret room in the back (wait, you know about it too?) 
... for finding my jacket with my wallet and cell phone in it
... for not passing judgement when i come back for the bajillionth time for my credit card and unclosed tab

and last but definitely not least... thank you...

... for convincing me that i shouldn't quit drinking for my new years resolution (#4)
author: Helen L.

description: The first couple of times I went to R bar I hated it.  It was crowded, the drinks were expensive, and people near us puked not once, but twice....come on people, get your friends to the bathroom before the spew all over my shoes.  I have gone back to R bar a couple of times since because it is super close to my house and we end up there if the Vertigo bouncer won't let us in for free.  I have discovered that I can stand, and even like R bar if  1) we go early before everyone is trashed and puking on me, 2) I am already drunk, 3) we go sit in the back room with the vinyl couches and make our own dance party.  So to recap, go early, go drunk, and go to the back if you are going to R bar.
author: Jessica H.

description: The bartenders kill it here!  No matter how busy, they are always extremely attentive and fast.  Great place to post up with some friends and throw some back--Fernet and more Fernet...Good times for sure!
author: Jeff A.

description: Other than the fact that during my second out of four drop-ins the "just subbing" bartender was the best-looking and most charming Irish import I have ever met and that he made a truly wonderful cosmo, I cannot recommend R Bar for a special visit.  It is what it is:  a bar and, sometimes, a culinary industry water hole.  Not bad but nothing special.  A quick trot down Polk will reveal more entertaining spots.
author: Poet D.

description: Divey. Pretty cool hang-out bar located in trannyland.  Awesome bartenders and great jukebox!
author: Cesar Thomas V.

description: 5 stars to the bartenders, some friends wanted to play 1-4-24 and they did not have enough dice so one of the bartenders left and went to the dollar store and bought some.  I do like the juke box! I suck at 1-4-24.
author: Sarah B.

description: The best bar in the city Sunday through Wednesday. Always gets busy, but never overcrowded. Straight-forward, honest drinking bar with no pretense, a good crowd, and pro bartenders. On the weekends, it is overrun by pointed shoes and striped-shirts. Taste those Jager-Bombs! Also, the big guy that works the door there occasionally is a humorless prick.
author: Big S.

description: Jukebox with MGMT, MSTRKRFT, Sneaky Sound System and Juan Maclean - what's not to like.
author: Mark P.

description: Fun bar, tooooo hot and crowded on the weekends for a fat Italian like me.
author: Max C.

description: oregon duck fans pack this place and yell their butts off for football as the game is on every tv but one- the bar tenders are attentive and the service is good
author: david f.

description:
5 Stars for the MANY fun nights I've drank myself into oblivion here
-
1 Star for the icky icky bathroom
----------
4 Stars

Gotta give some love to my neighborhood watering hole.  When my roomie and I can't make up our mind where to go guess where we end up...... R BAR! woo! The drinks are reasonably priced.  Beware it gets a little packed on the weekends.
author: Ashley Q.

description: This place is cool pre ten o'clock when there's a lot of space and no loud screaming bridge and tunnel drunk chicks to annoy you. And after ten? Well, that's when the loud screaming bridge and tunnel crowd come in... beware!!
author: Cathy T.

description: All the times I've frequented this place were on weekends, and I agree with most of you, it is a sardine-packed joint filled with soon-to-be yuppie youths or already-there yuppie professionals.  Nothin' wrong with that.  I've always enjoyed my time!  Cheers to Chris (bartender and part owner) for his success, but as a person who needs my space and conversations, I would definitely not  recommend a weekend visit.  For those on the prowl, this is definitely a good market to start shopping! ;-)
author: Cherry M.

description: This place is a must-stop for me every time I visit SF.  A cool bar with a fun crowd and great bartenders whose love of the Red Sox makes this Boston girl swoon.
author: Rachel C.

description: Great bar tenders, fun crowd! It gets a bit too busy on the weekends. I  can't tell you how how their mixed drinks are but that's because I love beer so much.
author: Kim S.

description: If you want a flash back to your fun lovin' days in college, this place is great. If you hated college or have simply moved beyond that phase in life, this place is not so great.
author: Justin C.

description: Ehh.  This is how I'd describe this bar.  Not really memorable, not really offensive either.  It was hella crowded and hot when we went (it was a weekend night); and unfortunate for my party, there was someone close by us who was gassy!  Not a good combination.  Anyhow, I won't hold this against the R Bar itself.  The bouncer outside was really nice and friendly.
author: Sarah F.

description: Went there a few beers deep, several glasses of wine under and had a blast. Wasn't too crowded but crowded enough- bring a group of your friends and enjoy the jukebox
author: Angela O.

description:
Eh...I was really not "wowed" by this bar at all. There is nothing impressive about the decor or the service. My friend said "a bar is a bar," and headed for a drink. But for me, a bar has to have more than alcohol and a place to sit down. If the crowd/vibe isn't right, it's not worth going no matter how many cosmos you have in your system.

The crowd here was pretty lame. I'm sure some nights are better than others, but honestly, I don't know why you would pick this bar out of all the other fun/lively ones to go to. Unless you were like me, and hopped into R Bar hoping to be surprised.
author: Nicole R.

description: Good bar. Nice crowd. Cozy.
author: Randy W.

description: i guess i might have a better experience on a weekday, but this place is just way too crowded and stuffy on a saturday night. it was just uncomfortable. the crowd was ok, but just way too many people packed into a tiny setting. drink prices were pretty decent. i believe it was $4 for a well drink on a saturday night. i can't complain about that. but overall, i'd rather go to a place where i can actually move around and breathe...
author: Andrew T.

description: Fernet, Highlife, redsox, Tod.....this bar is as good as it gets.  Loud music, no BS bar tending.  If you don't like this bar, you aren't the kinda person who should hang here.
author: Jamie B.

description: I dont know what it is about this place that makes it so I have never left this place sober. Todd and Chris should rename it the black hole. They keep their jukebox filled with classics... the kind that make  you want to sing along and shake your booty. Seriously though... make sure your liver is fully trained before entering this bar. The Fernet NEVER stops flowing here... I've always had a great time here. Who knew dive bars could be so much fun??!!! :-D
author: Marina K.

description: I have to give it four stars because it tends to get too damn crowded. Best time to go here would be Sunday evening and early to mid week evenings. The bartenders are great and I'm not just saying that because most of them are cute. Everyone that works there is very friendly, the drinks are reasonable and the jukebox has great music. Love living close by. Now that I am done with school I hope to spend more time hanging out there.
author: Heather L.

description: I have loved this bar before on industry nights, if you happen to be out on a Monday, and it's got a great vibe, not packed at all, but with all the right people. Then we went last night, and on a weekend night, it's a completely different bar. Go on a week night if you go.
author: Sarah R.

description: I just can't like this bar no matter how often I've tried.  Too much B&T action going on here.  It's ridiculous that it gets so friggin' crowded that they have to stamp your wrist at the door.  Lame.  There are so many better bars around this 'hood I'm not sure why you would frequent the one that most of the legitimate locals won't admit to going to. They get one star for a clean bathroom and friendly bartenders.
author: Jill D.

description: Great place to have a drink and hang with friends.  Cocktails are strong & tasty, bartenders friendly.  A bit of moving around room and a bit of seating...falls into the class of bar that u can walk into anytime and enjoy.
author: Julia W.

description:
I must admit this place has GREAT bartenders! One fine workday I strolled up here for a shot of Fernet, downed it and was about to leave when the bartender on duty questioned my drink choice and my relcutance to stay for awhile. He got me another round (on him) and we chatted it up for a bit and I felt better. I had high hopes for this place but then I made the mistake of showing up on a weekend.....

The place lives up to everyone else's reviews: youngin's from the Marina (or at least they try and act like they are) who are interested in hooking up and getting smashed (and not neccessarily in that order). Oh yeah and another thing: just because I'm now in my late 20's (gulp!) does not make me an "older woman"! This is ACTUAL dialog I had with one patron:
          Jock Boy:Hey....(pause because he thinks he's being smooth) How's it go-in'? (elogated going--I hate it when people do this!)
          me: I'm all good you?
          Jock Boy: Pretty good! Me and my boys are out having a guy's night
           me:Awesome....(awkward pause)
           Jock Boy: So are you like, here by yourself?
           me: Yeah, I'm killing time before I meet up with a group of friends
           Jock Boy: Cool......(another awkward pause)...so do you mind if I ask how old you are?
           me: I'm 27
           Jock Boy: Wow.....so I bet you have your own place then huh?
           me: (baffled by this response) Uh yeah kind of....
           Jock Boy: Cool....yeah I live with 4 other people in a two bedroom. It sucks.
           me:Sorry to hear that....(friend of Jock Boy comes up whining that he and the rest of the group are bored and want to leave)
            Jock Boy (to his friend): This older chick seems to be cool. Plus she has her own place (in the background I am grumpy now that I've been delegated to the older woman catagory and that I may be unwillingly made host of his afterparty with all his loser friends)
           The rest of the conversation went downhill from there. Needless to say I left the bar without Jock Boy (but not without some heavy lying)

So yeah stay away (or I will until I'm at least 40, then dealing with those young males will be a thrill rather than an eyerolling experience)
author: Veronica G.

description: The thing I remember most about this bar is the mens room.  At the urinal there are a ton of photos of good looking women pointing in the direction of your wang.... laughing.  That is right, if your confidance hasn't been shaken enough being shot down all night.  These photos will get you freaked.
author: Thadd L.

description: Best place to watch Oregon Duck football...GOOOOOOOOOO DUCKS!
author: Lisa D.

description: I like coming here-i don't too often, but everytime I do-it's super packed-evern Wednesday nights can randomly get packed. The bartenders are super-friendly and everyone that comes here is super friendly also-they have a lot of tvs so its great when the game is on or something! It's a huge fernet account-I've only tried it a few times, but don't prefer it-oh and they have Tiger Beer!
author: Dessa R.

description: Awesome bartenders. Cool crowd. Anywhere with Busch on tap, I am in!
author: Clay G.

description: I'm a fan of R Bar!  Possibly my favorite local dive bar.  Can't beat a 3 block walk home at 2am.  The drinks are cheap and strong.  I always manage to grab a little table and perch there all night unwinding with friends after a long week.  They have a pretty good jukebox as well - more alternative rock, less top 40's.  It's a breath of fresh air from all of the top 40 music that plays elsewhere.  It's an interesting crowd.  Lots of guys tend to flock here for some reason, but they're not all douchey, sleazy peoples.  I've experienced friendly conversations with no sleazy intentions.  They mind their own business and everyone seems to have the same mindset - time to unwind with cheap drinks and friends vs. being on the prowl.
author: Lynda N.

description: Such a fun place, coolest bartenders in town -- Wednesday nights with Rick and Jules are so f***in' fun!  Can it get noisy?  Sure. Can it get crowded?  Hope so.  Do I always meet new and fun people no matter when I go?  Hell yeah!  If you want somewhere fun and not pretentious with super bartenders who keep the libations flowing, come on down.
author: Kate C.

description: I'd have to agree with the naysayers; R Bar kindof sucks.  It's narrow, loud, and you walk out smelling of a gnarly combo of male sweat and their cheap cologne from being stuck near the bar trying to order.
author: Helen C.

description: If you bleed fernet like I do, then this is the place for you.  R Bar is in Fernet Branca's elite club of the Pouring 20's.  Which, as far as my ignorance allows, means they serve up a $hit ton of fernet on a annual basis.  They love their sports and have Phish and The Dead on the juke box.  Beyond the owners being cool as f***, the other bar staff are fun and fast and sling the booze like the pros they are.  It is definitely a meathead fest on the weekends but during the week you can belly up and chill out and tiw one on at the bar.  After all, it is R Bar.
author: Chard M.

description: Good music, total meat-market, but fun - especially if you're in the mood for a low-key night with friends. Weeknights are great here too - fun spot.
author: sarahjane s.

description:
The drinks were reasonably-priced ($4/pint), so I drank myself into oblivion and consequently danced like the silly, drunken girl that I was in front of my co-workers, including my boss at an after-work function.  Oops.  Mental note: pretend I don't remember anything on Monday morning.  

Well, I had a good time, so I'll give the place 4 stars, but I do agree that at some point the bar suddenly filled up and I could feel the fun whoosh out the door with the air.  I'll leave earlier next time.
author: Catherine Y.

description: One of the best bars in the city!  If you want to enjoy R bar go in Sunday through Thursday,  it's not so crowded and thats when you can have the most fun with the bartenders. Best person to get to know on the staff......Miguell the bar back, he's the guy behind the guy.  Don't worry Chris and Todd I still think you guys are dreamy!
author: Tommy W.

description: Although crowded the barkeep was quiick to notice those in need of a first round. The winter heat wave was def. a factor as i truly believe good day weather makes for awesome sf nights. The crowd was pretty friendly and seemed to come from all nooks and crannies of SF. I recommend coming back..and i will.
author: Joe J.

description: Good dive, good people, DAMN GOOD FERNET!!! Try once, love it forever. Well placed in the neighborhood so your tongue won't get dry while making the trek from Hemlock to Aces....
author: David R.

description:
Everyone wants to stake claim to R Bar: I discovered it first, so it's mine. It's in my neighborhood, so it's mine. I'm from Oregon, so it's mine (this is a big one).  

I fall into all three of the above categories, and I do feel like I have some vague R Bar right of ownership.  But not half as much as some of the other kids I see there, sticking around until after last call--and sometimes even after the lights come on.

Since that's not the sort of entitlement I feel, I go home before the lights are flipped and before I'm kicked to the curb, but I still appreciate R Bar's always-welcoming--albeit always-crowded--environment and super friendly staff.
author: Hannah J.

description: Been coming here since they opened and after I moved to Vegas I come when I'm in town. Was here last week and had a great time. I walked in and thankfully it wasn't packed in with the Dbag crew it sometimes gets but just some of the original locals. After numerous Oly's and Fernets we stumbled out and off to Cantina for more delicious libations. It was good to be home! Thanks Chris and Todd.
author: Bill H.

description: Well this bar was fun, but for many unrelated reasons most likely, but then again who knows.  Go feeling feisty in gym clothes when you feel like goofin' off and drinking and smoking and you will have a good time.  We had a blast, but i think we would have had fun regardless.  A social playground for us, but anyplace that allows you to see it that way is pretty cool.  Was a fun mix of people to play around with.
author: Today Y.

description: If a bar can actually not be so offensive ... then it deserves *4* stars. There's no particular crowd here. You got the jukebox... which keeps all the rockers and hip hoppers on a friendly vibe. It's chill ...if you're looking for a "scene" or some excitement this aint the place for you.
author: flo t.

description:
i have so many stories of fun times at this bar i don't know where to begin.    i'm almost glad i don't live in the neighborhood anymore because having this place in close proximity might turn me into a lush.  oh.  wait.

that being said, what everyone says about chris and todd is true.  i also have to give a special shout out to will, don't let his surly demeanor fool you, he's actually a closet sweetheart.  and props to my favorite weekend daytime bartender of all time, ed.

do avoid ducks game days.  unless, you know, you're like a fan.  in which case i have to say, dayum!  you guys are loud!
author: liesl k.

description: Alright, so you look at this place from outside.  Guess you could call it a hole in the wall kind of place.  Actually, I thought it was a porn shop, cuz of the look it had from the outside.  Its just a bar with sports playing on each TV, side table to just sit on stools and chat, and they have a jukebox.  Um. . . .its just a plain Jane kind of place to me.  The people hanging there looked normal, and the bartenders are a bit white trash looking with beer bellies and all, but that's it.  Its missing something for me.  It was cool I could bring food from outside to hang out here and the bathrooms where just wardrobe closet looking doors with one stall off the back room.  I guess that was the only thing that made this place unique, but damn you guys.  Why do you always play music to freaking loud, that you make people want to leave, cuz we can't hear each other chat.  A big no no for me.  Oh, and beers are reasonably at $4 each. . . .Nah, this place was just ok.  Nothing unique, nothing special and that's it.  Rather find another spot that's more happening or intriguing to me.   I was yawning out of this place pretty quick. . .see ya!
author: Janice F.

description: Probably getting a little too crowded on weekend nights for its own good (since it's not that big of a place) but still....drinks here are mixed for drunks ("I'm here to get DRUNK!"), so come to booze or get out of the way. Great jukebox and usually a good flick on the tv. What goes on in the little back room? Inquiring minds want to know...great stories on the wall in the bathroom... I've never seen a more savage (or appropriate) review of "Divine Secrets of the Ya Ya Sisterhood"...
author: Mike P.

description: Aw R Bar! How I do love you! Whether it is pre-party shots before we head on our way, or at the end of the night blacked out, I always have a good time here. Great bartenders who are friendly and attentive. Oh Todd...where fore out thou?
author: michelle k.

description: I have never been here at night but during the day for a ducks game it is the place to be. The set up is a little strange but I realized once you walk to the back there are some more seats. I really have no clue if the drinks were good, the beer was and well I never paid for anything which is the beauty of going with a group. Oregon fans all around for some footballl is really the only reason for me to go to this bar but hey it was a lot of fun.
author: Carli M.

description: I love this bar. Possibly too much to go back. You see this is the type of place that makes me revert back to what I like to call the young and stupid Amy. Every time I think I've left her behind, well places like this prove otherwise. I suppose this is why I try to stick to wine bars. Sure not always as much fun, but at least I remember what I said the next day. Oh and I suppose I should mention glasses of wine are just five bucks... which is alas how I ended up in the state I was in. Love the bartenders, too!
author: a p.

description: this is a bar for boozers.  I think my favorite night is sunday - you know, to kick off the work week properly.  the bartenders are great. and, it's always a fun crowd.
author: Angela N.

description: Went last night (a Thurs) and it had a good number of people, but definitely nowhere near packed. I got a gin and tonic which was a little on the strong side, but that's good, right? The average age was lower than what I've seen at some other places, probably closer to 25 which is refreshing. We sat in the back, because there was lots of seating. The music was slightly too loud, because I couldn't hear the people I was with when they sat next to me. Also, they had some weird movie on the TVs with Steve Martin and Martin Short...
author: Matt H.

description: This aRt bar is a wonderful polk street stop, conveniently located near a late night mexican taqueria and Slider's Hamburger joint. The drinks are affordable (especially when you ask for the cheapest beer they have, Olympia = seriously, what is this beer??)  there is an awesome juke box, sexy tunes playing, and even space to dance. The back room is awesome if you're with a big group but you'll often have to get there early on a Friday or Saturday night. This place gets packed and for good reason.
author: Jessica M.
