description: Great music playing in the jukebox, bartenders are ultra friendly, great vibe of people, dancing too.  I love this bar!
author: Christina S.

description: good place to kick off a night in the polk st area. its a fun and chill bar. good crowd. theres even a little room in the back that you can reserve for a private party. definitely good times!
author: Linda N.

description:
Me'n the sibs were celebrating a pretty important anniversary yesterday. For us that means drinks. Lots of drinks. 
The brother decided on Fernet. Three shots later, I still didn't like it. No amount of time living and drinking in SF will make it not taste like the medicine cabinet concoctions we used to make the little sister drink as kids. Who, by the way, told us she was taking shots of Vodka but confessed this morning that it was water. Sneaky bitch. Damn cute bartender.
Anyhow, the bar... my good friend and I used to come here as young(er) single ladies because the sex ratio was always in our favor. The drinks are strong, and there's a kickass taqueria next store.  They play really good music, although a bit  too loudly for my aging ears.  
Minus one star for the douchey weekend crowd which can't really be avoided, plus four stars for the hot, nice bartender. What I said to him on my way out, I don't remember, but I hope it wasn't anything too inappropriate.
author: deb C.

description: The bartenders/owners of R Bar will make you feel like home when you walk in. A very low-key bar, warm and friendly, always has a great vibe and good drinks. My fiance surprized me with a birthday party in the back room and it was fabulous.
author: Crisa M.

description: Not sure about this place.  I think if I was in college I would love it.  Olympia (It's the water) cans for like $2.  personaly I think that is overpriced.  Jukebox had a great selection of music, might be the only reason to go back and hangout for a while.  time will only tell....
author: Shawn S.

description: Fun, fun, fun especially when you've had a few, which is what i did the first time i came here with a bunch of old and new friends.
author: cyndi b.

description: My crew went to this place after my bro's friend suggested it. It was kinda nearby our hotel, the Opal Inn, so walking to there wasn't a problem. The first night we went was on a late Friday and of course it was packed but we were able to get our drinks in a timely manner. Drink prices were reasonable: $5 for my Jack & Diet. Quite a few good-looking girls. We liked it so we returned on Saturday night but early and it was empty of course cuz it was freakin' early. Again, attentive staff got our drinks quick and they put on college football. I'll probably return to this establishment whenever I return to SF.
author: A N.

description: Good times!! I had a great time but does get really crowded. I would not sugest going here if your with a lot of people.
author: Cyndee P.

description: I dig this place.  I can't give it a full rating yet because I've only been once - but i got a very good vibe from the first encounter.  The bartender/owner asked all of our names.  Seems like it's the kinda place that they like to get to know their customers on a very friendly basis.  I plan on becoming a regular as it is just a few blocks my mi casa!
author: Kelly D.

description: I really like R Bar.  I once had a bloody mary there, and it was delish.
author: Karl B.

description: This is a great bar!  The bartenders are really fun and the crowd is usually friendly.  It can get REALLY hot in there on crowded nights, but the positives definitely outweigh the negatives.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Lots of good bars in the city but this place is like a 2nd home. Great jukebox, friendly staff who take care of you, and something entertaining happening any given time. Cheers...
author: Matt L.

description: The best times I've had at this bar have been on a Sunday afternoon at 5 when I was too drunk off margaritas from Nick's to remember where I was.  Bartenders are nice so when you're there with two friends and there's no one else in the bar it's fine.  On a Saturday night, though just stay away.  always way too crowded and full of people who try way too hard.  make sure if you are there to read the Under the Tuscan Sun review above the toilet in the men's room-quite random and funny.
author: Justin P.

description: I've been going here multiple times each week for over a year now. I guess that in itself says a lot. Some of my visits I don't remember due to their kick ass Long Islands. Some of the visits I don't want to remember due to various unnamed reasons. But R Bar is always great. You always think the bartenders are your best buddies. You always get amazing drinks. It's just pure quality.
author: Magnus F.

description: Great Place. Even better if you can make it Monday-Wed. It can be a little busy on the weekends. Owners are great-they remember you, well at least me! If you are low on cash like lots of SF cats or you just want to be a hipster order the bar favorite Olympia in a can "OLY"...This place is number 1 in the country for Fernet, drink it up.
author: Andrew G.

description: My friend used to bartend here YEAAARRRRSSSSS ago, but this place is awesome! Small but it has character, some nights it's packed others it's not, but anytime I've come it's been a good ol' time! The bartender's are all awesome, the drinks are reasonable, the bathroom's a lil gross, but what bar bathroom is squeaky clean?
author: S A.

description: i've been here twice and wanted to like it, but i just don't. what a bore! no atmosphere or energy. i was with some really fun people both times i came, and that didn't even help. even worse, all of the patrons seemed like immature 21 yr olds. absolutely nothing attractive about this bar.
author: Michelle I.

description: i hate this bar, it's loud and gross.  it's the kind of place where you go if you're with a group of people that you don't really want to talk to and one of them ends up puking in the bathroom.
author: Tabatha Y.

description: Cant tell from outside but this bar is great! Not too crowded but not dead either. Bartenders were very attentive and helpful. Nice crowd enjoying the night. Would def go here again and bring more friends. Not any more expensive than other bars either. Two pints up!
author: Jameson B.

description: Possibly the best bar in the world. Incredibly hospitable and very easy to get acquainted with the staff and the (1,000) regulars.  Inexpensive (and stiff) drinks, freindly vibe, any sport/team you want to watch, and a mix of patrons of all ages.  Overall, a great place to not remember what the fuck happened when waking the following morning.
author: Marko C.

description: Cool, basic hangout bar. Friendly, unpretentious, bartenders that don't act entitled (a rarity in SF), always a fun drinking crowd. Men's bathroom is freakin' hilarious (those who have had the pleasure of pissing there know what I'm talking about).
author: Jonathan M.

description: This place is th best!!!  Great staff.  Great, stiff drinks.  Great jukebox.  Great essay in the men's room.  Go there!!!
author: justin j.

description: both times i've visited, I stumbled in drunk, told myself, "what the hell am i doing here...fuk it, you might aswell get a drink, you're here", downed my drink and got the hell out.  it's a sort-of dive bar. sort-of.
author: Don C.

description:
this bar is alright. i've had so many friends boast about it that i finally had to check it out. granted, i did go on a friday night, but i could barely walk into the place. after loads of pushing and excuse me's (and dirty looks) i made it to the back where my friends decided to be. grabbed a drink and tried to relax. although it's hard when there are people migrating to and fro, a barback always coming in and out, and stupid ho's spilling drinks on me. so that kinda crap always forces me to drink more and i usually go for shots. so i order some shots... and they give it to me in some square shaped candle holder. i thought, "ooh kinda cool... " until when taking the shot, some of it spills down my cheek because of the awkward angles of the glass. novelty is one thing... but i think functionality should win when it comes to shot glasses. 
anyway, i'd like to come back when it's more mellow... seems like a cool spot. i'll just never go again on the weekends. the bartenders are friendly, so that's always a plus.
author: Erin D.

description: this was our last stop at the end of a day of drinking that began at 3pm, and we got here right before last call.  as excited as i tried to be for my gin and tonic, it was hard to choke down at this point.  from what i remember, the gin did taste pretty good- but i have no idea how much it cost or what kind of gin it was.  i do remember having to shoulder my way through the entire bar to get to the bathroom, and all the way back to the front where my friends were... and were still waiting for a drink i might add.  it was just ridiculously overcrowded.
author: Sean L.

description: What Teapot said.  If you're ever looking to bro-down in San Francisco, but don't want to head to the Marina or North Beach, this is definitely your spot.
author: Del D.

description: I went here after dinner with zero expectations since the street outside isn't the nicest cleanest place (nor the worst I'm sure).  Inside it's cool thought and surprisingly clean for a bar bar.  The ambiance and decor here reminds me of a small town college town bar.  I'm not quite sure why there seems to be so much buzz about this place among some people, I didn't see anything particularly memorable about it.  I did get great service though and surprisingly enough from the barback / bus guy.  People working in this role normally can't or won't for some reason make you a drink they just move the glassware around and clean stuff up.  So I was pleasantly surprised when he asked me what I wanted and made my drink then went back to his other chores.  That's the way service should work, with everyone helping out when necessary.  My drink was only $5 too which is $1-$3 cheaper than most city places.
author: P H I L H.

description: Great bar, fun atmosphere and excellent crowd, but then I was there for a birthday so I knew 80 of the 82 people in there. Good music but I think the speakers were shot. Most impressive was 2 drinks cost me $8, I thought the bartender meant per drink. Thank you.
author: Cbr A.

description: drinks were cheap, staff was awesome (and i don't use that word lightly)  all i had to do was make eye contact and raise my glass, had my next drink in less than a minute on a busy, packed saturday night.  good music, i need to try it not on a saturday.
author: kiki b.

description: everyone needs a vacay, so i decided to pack up the fernet wagon and take this show on the road. seattle is but a drop in the apertif ocean, so i headed down to the american capitol of fernet: san francisco.  some say that fernet's american resurrection started back in 2005 with the sf weekly article, "the myth of fernet", or you can date as far back as bill cosby's 1973 fat albert recollection of how fernet saved him from a certain sparrow.  either way, there's truth in numbers at r bar in san francisco's nob hill precinct.  despite grossing the highest fernet sales in the country, i was surprised by its demure exterior.  when i saw the eagle bar mats and a ledge of fernet bottles spanning the storefront, i knew i was home.  the night only got better from there: 12 drinks later, i asked the friendly (and not to mention easy on the eyes) bartender for our bill.  he looked at me, furrowed his brow, and then pointed at me as he said, "$30.  now, im not one to look a gift horse in the mouth, but my conscience was screaming when i replied, "no, for all of us".  he remained steadfast in his original quote, and to this day, im not sure if he honestly managed to overlook the slew of drinks he served us, but i have a feeling that r bar would be out of business by now if that was the case.  i guess there is truth in numbers, no matter how far off they are.
author: Amy H.

description: seems like everyone from around the hood comes out to this dive bar.  the drinks are reasonably priced and they have better selection of alcohol compared to the more so-called upscale lounges.
author: Alan N.

description: This is a good chill spot in the NoPa area.  Be warned, they don't serve liquor (except a korean liquor called soju or something, but it's pretty tasty).  They have 1 pool table, which I love, but i could use more.  Definitely a spot worth grabbing a drink at.
author: Jerry T.

description: Alright, now I don't wanna join in the saber rattling cries that routinely bash the Marina. It's not that I have any affection for the Marina, but rather because it's just too easy of a target. The lines are clearly drawn in this love/hate relationship, so is there really anything more to debate? However, since the R Bar is hanging down on the edge of the Loin I feel the need to weigh in on the place. I've been to the place a few times over the past two years to watch hockey games (there are not many places in my hood that will show the Sharks). R has the makings of a good dive: stiff drinks, good prices, low level lighting, rock-n-roll juke, and lots of red (for some reason this appeals to me in a dive). However, it's the clientele here that makes this place stand out in a neighborhood full of dives. The fact of the matter is that the folks who frequent this place strike me as more Marina then Tenderloin. Every time I've been there it's felt like a frat scene. Think of R as a Marina dive with a slight edge, and if that's what you're looking for then it's a great joint for you. Want a Tenderloin dive? Hit the Ha-Ra and the large collection of it's brethren.
author: Rob S.

description: since i live like 3 blocks from here, R Bar is a decent place to go when i don't feel like going anywhere far. some nights the crowd is good, but a lot of the time it's not that great (sausagefest, cough). i'm always stoked when a place serves PBR, so that's a definite plus. so yeah, R bar is okay in my opinion. realllllly hit or miss like a lot of bars in the city, but it's worth checking out if you like dive-ish bars by all means.
author: Nathan S.

description: wonderful bartenders who poor a stiff drink. i'm headed there right now and forever...
author: Boyd W.

description: i know chris.   thanks for the shot of powers irish whiskey for whenever i come in and say hi. :)
author: Pickle R.

description: great place to blow off some steam.  drinks are strong.  nice mix of good looking people.  bartenders are pretty laid back.  offer them fernet or sambuca.  buy them a shot, its worth the return.  there is actually a lot of good looking women in the bar.  its not always a sausage fest.  the only bad thing is, party in the area can be a little tuff, but what place in the city is actually easy.
author: don j.

description: i would say three stars, but they get a bonus star for pimpin the fernet.  used to be too cool for school, but lately seems too damn crowded. ps - the bathrooms are semi-private (ie: you might be able to hide in there for a few minutes and do...ummm...stuff)
author: Patrick D.

description: Local dive... lots of  Fernet and PBR, hello ten years ago, but hey the vibe is cool
author: lee c.

description: Five stars - not for the nightlife - for the morning life - like the real morning - I am talking about 10 in the morning on Sundays.  This is when football starts and R Bar welcomes in anyone to some incredible (unheard of in SF) beer specials and a great open mind to what the fans care to do.  Incredibly easy parking around there at that time.  No better place in town to watch a game.
author: d l.

description: yes, i agree.  it's probably a great place to chill if you go during the week after work for happy hour maybe but at 10:30pm on a saturday night with 4 friends in tow, you can barely squeeze in past the bouncer at the front door.  thankfully my blonde friend kelly knows one the guys behind the bar so we got hooked up with cheap drinks fast but there was nowhere to stand in the whole room so we ambled our way to the "back room" just as a group of folks were vacating the banquette.  but the back room was too bright and the vibe totally fizzled in here and we ended up sitting around feeling rather downtempo despite the hoots and hollers and drunken debauchery happening in the main room by the 20-somethings who seemed to have recently discovered alcohol.  and to make matters worse, there was a couple sitting across from us who were clearly on some fun touchy-feely drugs because they just sat there for 2 and a half hours feeling eachother's faces and arms, occasionally making out, and just starting at each other to no end.  we were having an ok time listening to the jukebox go from van halen to the beastie boys to some weird dancehall reggaeton banghra stuff where it seemed to get stuck.  bleh!  to our e-tastic friends, however, it was probably the "best.bar.ever!"
author: Cyn B.
